original: chung ngu dang / chen po dag gis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chung ngu dang / chen po dag gis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The faculties and the powers are distinguished as weak and strong.

original: dbang po rnams ni chung ngu yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rnams ni chung ngu yin no //
translated: The faculties are weak.

original: stobs rnams ni chen po yin no //
analyzed: stobs rnams ni chen po yin no //
translated: The powers are strong.

original: 'di dag gi chung ngu dang / chen po'i bye brag ji lta bu zhe na /üîΩgtan tshigs su rdzi ba dang rdzi ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di dag gi chung ngu dang / chen po'i bye brag ji lta bu zhe na / gtan tshigs su rdzi ba dang rdzi ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: What is the difference between the weak and strong faculties?

original: de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa ma dad pa dang / le lo dang / brjod ngas pa dang / g-yeng ba dang / shes bzhin ma yin pa rnams par bar du kun du 'byung ba'i phyir dbang po rnams ni rdzi ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa ma dad pa dang / le lo dang / brjod ngas pa dang / g-yeng ba dang / shes bzhin ma yin pa rnams par bar du kun du 'byung ba'i phyir dbang po rnams ni rdzi ba yin no //
translated: The faculties are weak because they are overcome by their opposites, i.e., lack of faith, laziness, negligence, distraction, and lack of full awareness.

original: stobs rnams ni de lta ma yin pas yang de dag la stobs zhes bshad do //
analyzed: stobs rnams ni de lta ma yin pas yang de dag la stobs zhes bshad do //
translated: The powers are not like that, so they are called powers.üîΩThe first are the beginners,

original: las ni dang po pa dag dang // nges 'byed cha mthun rnams dang ni //
analyzed: las ni dang po pa dag dang // nges 'byed cha mthun rnams dang ni //
translated: and those who are in the stages conducive to penetration.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di @232b dag gnas skabs sngar bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di @232b dag gnas skabs sngar bshad pa yin no //
translated: These are the previously explained stages.

original: bsgom dang mthong la rab tu phye //
analyzed: bsgom dang mthong la rab tu phye //
translated: They are distinguished as meditation and seeing.

original: zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs gnyis yin pas gnas skabs bdun dag tu sde tshan bdun go rims bzhin rab tu 'byed cing rab tu rnam par 'jog pa 'am /üîΩgtso bor byed pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs gnyis yin pas gnas skabs bdun dag tu sde tshan bdun go rims bzhin rab tu 'byed cing rab tu rnam par 'jog pa 'am / gtso bor byed pa yin te /
translated: Since there are two states, the seven groups are respectively distinguished and determined in the seven states, or they are the principal factors.

original: las dang po pa'i gnas skabs su ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams so //
analyzed: las dang po pa'i gnas skabs su ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams so //
translated: In the state of the beginner, there are the four foundations of mindfulness.

original: dro bar gyur pa'i gnas skabs su ni yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa rnams so //
analyzed: dro bar gyur pa'i gnas skabs su ni yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa rnams so //
translated: In the state of heat, there is the correct determination of the four right efforts.

original: rtse mo'i gnas skabs su ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams so //
analyzed: rtse mo'i gnas skabs su ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams so //
translated: In the state of the summit, there are the four bases of supernatural power.

original: bzod pa'i gnas skabs su ni dbang po rnams so //
analyzed: bzod pa'i gnas skabs su ni dbang po rnams so //
translated: In the state of patience, there are the five faculties.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs su ni stobs rnams so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs su ni stobs rnams so //
translated: In the state of the supreme mundane state, there are the five powers.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs su ni byang chub kyi yan lag rnams so //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs su ni byang chub kyi yan lag rnams so //
translated: In the state of the path of meditation, there are the seven factors of enlightenment.

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs su ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs su ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'o //
translated: In the state of the path of seeing, there is the eightfold noble path.

original: khyad par thob pa'i rgyus brtson 'grus spel te /
analyzed: khyad par thob pa'i rgyus brtson 'grus spel te /
translated: The cause of attaining distinction is the increase of effort.

original: de'i phyir dro bar gyur pa dag la ni yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa rnams so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dro bar gyur pa dag la ni yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa rnams so //
translated: Therefore, the correct placements are in the stages of heat.

original: yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la 'jug pa'i phyir rtse mo dag la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba la 'jug pa'i phyir rtse mo dag la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The summits are called the ‚Äúengagements‚Äù because they engage the roots of virtue that do not decline.

original: rtse mo thob pa rtsa mi 'chad //
analyzed: rtse mo thob pa rtsa mi 'chad //
translated: Obtaining the summits does not sever the roots.

original: ces 'byung bas rtse mo rnams ni yongs su mi nyams pa dang / mthun pa dag la 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: ces 'byung bas rtse mo rnams ni yongs su mi nyams pa dang / mthun pa dag la 'jug pa yin te /
translated: Therefore the summits are compatible with not declining and they engage that.

original: 'di rnams kyis 'jug pa'i phyir 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis 'jug pa'i phyir 'jug pa'o //
translated: They are called ‚Äúengagements‚Äù because they engage that.

original: yongs su mi nyams pa ni bzod pa dag gi tshe yin te /
analyzed: yongs su mi nyams pa ni bzod pa dag gi tshe yin te /
translated: The forbearances are the time of nondecline.

original: de'i gnas skabs kyi ting nge 'dzin rnams 'byor pa'i rten yin pas rtse mo dag la ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i gnas skabs kyi ting nge 'dzin rnams 'byor pa'i rten yin pas rtse mo dag la ni rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The bases of supernatural power are posited in the summits because they are the support for the meditative stabilization of that state.

original: yang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i sgo nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang gi phyir snga ma gnyis kho na las yongs su nyams pa srid kyi bzod pa dag la ni yang yongs su nyams pa med pa de'i phyir dad pa la sogs
analyzed: yang yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i sgo nas zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gang gi phyir snga ma gnyis kho na las yongs su nyams pa srid kyi bzod pa dag la ni yang yongs su nyams pa med pa de'i phyir dad pa la sogs
translated: Also, it is stated in detail, ‚Äúbecause there is no complete degeneration,‚Äù because complete degeneration is possible only from the first two, but there is no complete degeneration from the stage of patience.

original: pa dbang po thob pa yin no //
analyzed: pa dbang po thob pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, faith and so on are obtained as faculties.

original: de bas na bzod pa dag la ni dbang po rnams rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de bas na bzod pa dag la ni dbang po rnams rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the faculties are posited in relation to the stage of patience.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis mi brdzi ba'i phyir ram zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gnas skabs de na nyon mongs pa kun du mi 'byung ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams kyis mi brdzi ba yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyis mi brdzi ba'i phyir ram zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gnas skabs de na nyon mongs pa kun du mi 'byung ba'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams kyis mi brdzi ba yin no //
translated: Or because they are not crushed by affliction means that at that stage, they are not crushed by affliction because affliction does not occur.

original: 'jig rten pa'i chos gzhan dag gis mi brdzi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yang na 'jig rten pa'i chos gzhan dag gis mi brdzi ba'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs su ni dad pa la sogs pa stobs rnams zhes bya bar @233a *üîΩ// rab tu 'byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i chos gzhan dag gis mi brdzi ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni yang na 'jig rten pa'i chos gzhan dag gis mi brdzi ba'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog gi gnas skabs su ni dad pa la sogs pa stobs rnams zhes bya bar @233a * // rab tu 'byed do //
translated: In the stage of the supreme mundane right, faith, etc. are called powers because they are not overcome by other mundane entities.üîΩBecause they are near enlightenment.

original: byang chub dang nye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang nye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byang chub dang nye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dang nye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means because they are near the knowledge of termination and non-arising.

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ni bsgom pa'i lam la yin gyi mthong ba'i lam la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ni bsgom pa'i lam la yin gyi mthong ba'i lam la ni ma yin te /
translated: The knowledge of termination and non-arising belong to the path of cultivation, not to the path of seeing.

original: mthong ba'i lam ni de dag dang thag ring ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam ni de dag dang thag ring ste /
translated: The path of seeing is far from them,

original: de'i bar du bsgom pa'i lam gyis chod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'gro bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i bar du bsgom pa'i lam gyis chod pa'i phyir ro // 'gro bas rab tu phye ba'i phyir //
translated: because the path of cultivation intervenes between them.üîΩBecause they are distinguished by going.

original: zhes bya ba ni lam la ni 'jig rten na 'dis 'gro'o zhes 'gro bas rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lam la ni 'jig rten na 'dis 'gro'o zhes 'gro bas rab tu phye ba yin no //
translated: In the world, a path is distinguished by going, i.e., by the going of beings.

original: yang na lam 'gro bas na lam yin te /
analyzed: yang na lam 'gro bas na lam yin te /
translated: Or else, it is a path because it is favorable,

original: 'jig rten na lam 'di dmar bu can du 'gro zhes zer ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten na lam 'di dmar bu can du 'gro zhes zer ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is said in the world, ‚ÄúThis path goes to Potala.‚Äù

original: mthong ba'i lam ni shin tu 'gro bas rab tu phye ba yin gyi bsgom pa'i lam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam ni shin tu 'gro bas rab tu phye ba yin gyi bsgom pa'i lam ni ma yin no //
translated: The path of insight is distinguished by its rapid progress, not by the path of cultivation.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: de ni myur bar 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni myur bar 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because it is rapid progress.

original: de dang ldan pa yang des myur du 'gro'i bsgom pa'i lam la ni sa'i dbye ba brtsal ba'i phyir yun ring mo zhig tu 'gro'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa yang des myur du 'gro'i bsgom pa'i lam la ni sa'i dbye ba brtsal ba'i phyir yun ring mo zhig tu 'gro'o //
translated: One who possesses it goes quickly, but one on the path of cultivation goes for a long time, because one is seeking to traverse the stages.üîΩOthers say:

original: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni slob dpon yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni slob dpon yin te /
translated: The master Vasubandhu.

original: bdag la sogs pa zhes bsam pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa zhes bsam pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he thinks of the self, etc.üîΩIn the same order as the Abhidharma

original: go rims ma nyams pa kho nar zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba de ltar de bzhin du ma sbyar bar byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa rnams go rims bzhin du brjod de /
analyzed: go rims ma nyams pa kho nar zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba de ltar de bzhin du ma sbyar bar byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa rnams go rims bzhin du brjod de /
translated: The order of the factors of enlightenment is the same as the order in which they are discussed in the Abhidharma.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams mthong ba'i lam la 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag rnams mthong ba'i lam la 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the limbs of enlightenment are placed in the path of seeing.

original: yul rnam pa mang po la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni yul ni gzugs la sogs pa'i bye brag dang sngon po la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa mang po yin te /
analyzed: yul rnam pa mang po la zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni yul ni gzugs la sogs pa'i bye brag dang sngon po la sogs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa mang po yin te /
translated: With regard to the phrase ‚Äúwith regard to many different objects,‚Äù the objects are many different kinds, such as form, etc., and different kinds, such as blue, etc.

original: de la g-yeng ba ni rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: de la g-yeng ba ni rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
translated: Distraction is the scattering of the mind.

original: 'di dag la yul rnam pa mang po la g-yeng bar 'phro ba'i ngang tshul yod pas na yul rnam pa mang po la g-yeng bar 'phro ba'i blo rnams te /
analyzed: 'di dag la yul rnam pa mang po la g-yeng bar 'phro ba'i ngang tshul yod pas na yul rnam pa mang po la g-yeng bar 'phro ba'i blo rnams te /
translated: The mind is scattered and scatters with regard to many different objects.

original: de dag tshar gcad pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag tshar gcad pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa rnams so //
translated: The applications of mindfulness are for the purpose of subduing them.

original: zhen pa la brten pa zhes bya ba ni sred pa la brten pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhen pa la brten pa zhes bya ba ni sred pa la brten pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbased on attachment‚Äù means based on craving.

original: dran pa'i kun du rtog pa rnams zhes bya ba ni yul nyams su myong ba dran pa'i kun du rtog pa rnams zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: dran pa'i kun du rtog pa rnams zhes bya ba ni yul nyams su myong ba dran pa'i kun du rtog pa rnams zhes bya ba'am /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúconceptual thoughts of mindfulness‚Äù means conceptual thoughts of the experience of objects.

original: 'dod pa'i kun du rtog pa rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i kun du rtog pa rnams zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúconceptual thoughts of the desire realm‚Äù is the same as before.

original: de'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩdgos pa rnam pa bzhi bsgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // dgos pa rnam pa bzhi bsgrub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúBy the power of those‚Äù means by the power of the applications of mindfulness.

original: dgos pa rnam pa @233b bzhi ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba dang ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / de bzhin du dge ba ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams gnas par bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dgos pa rnam pa @233b bzhi ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams spang ba dang ma skyes pa rnams mi skyed pa dang / de bzhin du dge ba ma skyes pa rnams skyed pa dang / skyes pa rnams gnas par bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIn order to accomplish the four aims‚Äù means that the four aims are: to abandon the evil nonvirtuous dharmas that have already arisen, to prevent the nonvirtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen from arising, and similarly, to produce the virtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen, and to remain in the virtuous dharmas that have already arisen.

original: de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin rnam par sbyong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i 'og tu yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa dag gi rjes la ting nge 'dzin rnam par sbyong ba'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams rab tu 'byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ting nge 'dzin rnam par sbyong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i 'og tu yang dag par rab tu 'jog pa dag gi rjes la ting nge 'dzin rnam par sbyong ba'i phyir rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa rnams rab tu 'byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúAfter that, in order to purify samƒÅdhi‚Äù means that after the applications of mindfulness, in order to purify samƒÅdhi, the bases of supernatural power are distinguished.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams kyi bdag por gyur pa zhes bya ba ni de 'dren par byed pa yin pa'i phyir de dag gi bdag por gyur par rig par bya'o //üîΩdbang po de dag nyid gang gi tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs kun du spyod pa las nges par rgyal ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams kyi bdag por gyur pa zhes bya ba ni de 'dren par byed pa yin pa'i phyir de dag gi bdag por gyur par rig par bya'o // dbang po de dag nyid gang gi tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs kun du spyod pa las nges par rgyal ba ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe lord of supramundane dharmas‚Äù means that the faculties are the lord of those dharmas because they lead to them.üîΩThe faculties are called ‚Äúpowers‚Äù when they are victorious over the resistances.

original: ma dang pha la sogs pa kun du spyod pa las nges par rgyal bar gyur pa de'i tshe stobs rnams so //
analyzed: ma dang pha la sogs pa kun du spyod pa las nges par rgyal bar gyur pa de'i tshe stobs rnams so //
translated: The faculties are called ‚Äúpowers‚Äù when they are victorious over the resistances that are opposed to them, such as the lack of shame and the lack of abashment, etc.

original: dbang po'i gnas skabs na ni nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa srid de /
analyzed: dbang po'i gnas skabs na ni nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pa srid de /
translated: When one is in the stage of the faculties, it is possible to engage in the passions.

original: bzod pa'i gnas skabs na ni thag ring ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzod pa'i gnas skabs na ni thag ring ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But when one is in the stage of the acceptances, it is not possible, because the passions are far away.

original: mthong ba'i lam la ni byang chub kyi yan lag rnams zhes bya ba ni byang chub ni zag pa med pa'i shes rab yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la ni byang chub kyi yan lag rnams zhes bya ba ni byang chub ni zag pa med pa'i shes rab yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The members of enlightenment are on the path of insight, because enlightenment is uncontaminated wisdom.

original: gnyi ga la ni lam gyi yan lag rnams zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam dag la'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga la ni lam gyi yan lag rnams zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam dang bsgom pa'i lam dag la'o //
translated: The members of the path are on both the path of insight and the path of cultivation.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: It is said:

original: bsgom pa'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa ni bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam yongs su rdzogs pa ni bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The complete path of meditation is the complete path.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa gnas skabs der gyur pa na ste der gyur na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba nas byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bsgom pa yongs su
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa gnas skabs der gyur pa na ste der gyur na dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ba nas byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi bar du yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro zhes bsgom pa yongs su
translated: When the eightfold noble path becomes that, then the four establishments of mindfulness are complete, up to the seven factors of enlightenment are complete.

original: rdzogs na zhes gsungs pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam la yang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad po yod do zhes bya bar mngon no //
analyzed: rdzogs na zhes gsungs pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i lam la yang 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad po yod do zhes bya bar mngon no //
translated: Since it is said that when the path of meditation is complete, it is understood that the eightfold noble path exists on the path of meditation.

original: mthong ba'i lam la ni bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la ni bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: On the path of seeing, the complete path does not become complete.

original: 'o na ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is it then?

original: bsgom pa'i lam la rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: It becomes complete on the path of meditation.

original: yang gsungs so zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga la lam gyi yan lag dag rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yang gsungs so zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga la lam gyi yan lag dag rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The phrase it is also said means that the limbs of the path are established in both.

original: 'di ni 'phags pa'i bden pa'i tshig bla dgas yin no zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam yin par ston to //üîΩji ltar rtogs pa'i lam gyis 'jug ces bya ba nas rgyas par 'di ni 'phags pa'i @234a * //üîΩlam yan lag brgyad kyi tshig bla dgas yin no zhes bya ba'i bar 'byung ba ni bsgom pa'i lam yin par ston te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'phags pa'i bden pa'i tshig bla dgas yin no zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam yin par ston to // ji ltar rtogs pa'i lam gyis 'jug ces bya ba nas rgyas par 'di ni 'phags pa'i @234a * // lam yan lag brgyad kyi tshig bla dgas yin no zhes bya ba'i bar 'byung ba ni bsgom pa'i lam yin par ston te /

translated: The term ‚Äúthat which is to be abandoned by the path of seeing‚Äù is stated in order to distinguish it from

original: skad cig ma gnyis pa la bzod pa dang po spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas the tshom spang bar 'gyur bas bzod pa dang po kho na shes pa ma yin no zhes bya bar go bar 'gyur gyi bzod pa gzhan dag ni ma yin pas de'i phyir nge
analyzed: skad cig ma gnyis pa la bzod pa dang po spang bar bya ba'i phra rgyas the tshom spang bar 'gyur bas bzod pa dang po kho na shes pa ma yin no zhes bya bar go bar 'gyur gyi bzod pa gzhan dag ni ma yin pas de'i phyir nge
translated: Since the second moment abandons the doubt that is to be abandoned by the first stage of patience, it is understood that the first stage of patience alone is not knowledge, but the other stages of patience are.

original: spang bar bya ba'i zhes khyad par smos so //
analyzed: spang bar bya ba'i zhes khyad par smos so //
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äúto be abandoned‚Äù is specified.

original: yang dag par rtog pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nye bar rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang dag par rtog pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nye bar rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it has the nature of correct conception means because it has the nature of correct investigation.

original: yang dag par rtog pa med pa dang yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa can ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di la yang dag par rtog pa med pas na yang dag par rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rtog pa med pa dang yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa can ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di la yang dag par rtog pa med pas na yang dag par rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: Because it is not correct conception and does not have the intention to investigate means that because it is not correct conception, it is not correct conception.

original: yongs su tshol bar sems shing 'dod pa ni yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa med pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su tshol bar sems shing 'dod pa ni yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa med pa'o //
translated: The intention to investigate and desire is the intention to investigate.

original: 'di la yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa med pas yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa med pas yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa can ma yin no //
translated: Since it is devoid of the intention to investigate, it is not the intention to investigate.

original: de ni yang dag par rtog pa med pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de ni yang dag par rtog pa med pa yang yin la /
translated: It is also the absence of correct view.

original: yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa can ma yin pa yang yin pas yang dag par rtog pa med pa dang / yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa can ma yin pa ste /üîΩde'i phyir zad pa shes @239a * //
analyzed: yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa can ma yin pa yang yin pas yang dag par rtog pa med pa dang / yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa can ma yin pa ste / de'i phyir zad pa shes @239a * //
translated: Since it is the absence of correct view and the absence of the intention to investigate, it is the absence of correct view and the absence of the intention to investigate.

original: pa dang mi skye ba shes pa lta ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: pa dang mi skye ba shes pa lta ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of non-arising are not views. This is the meaning.

original: 'di ji srid du bya ba ma byas pa de srid du sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa dag la nye bar rtog cing bsam pa dag pa nas mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ji skad bshad pa dag gis yongs su tshol bar byed do //
analyzed: 'di ji srid du bya ba ma byas pa de srid du sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i bden pa dag la nye bar rtog cing bsam pa dag pa nas mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa ji skad bshad pa dag gis yongs su tshol bar byed do //
translated: As long as one has not performed the action, for that long one investigates and contemplates the truths of suffering, etc., and from the purity of contemplation, one investigates with the aspects such as impermanence, as explained.

original: bya ba byas nas ni de dag gis sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'phags pa'i bden pa ji ltar mthong ba dag kho na la bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes te yang shes par byar med do zhes bya ba la sogs par so sor rtog pa tsam du
analyzed: bya ba byas nas ni de dag gis sdug bsngal la sogs pa 'phags pa'i bden pa ji ltar mthong ba dag kho na la bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes te yang shes par byar med do zhes bya ba la sogs par so sor rtog pa tsam du
translated: Having performed their function, they are merely the discernment of the truths of suffering, etc., as they have been seen, such as ‚ÄúI have fully understood suffering and there is nothing more to understand.‚Äù

original: zad de / de lta bas na de dag ni lta ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no //üîΩde las gzhan 'phags blo gnyi ga / zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa nas lam la rjes su shes pa'i bar gyi shes rab de ni nye bar rtog par zhugs pa yang yin la /
analyzed: zad de / de lta bas na de dag ni lta ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin no // de las gzhan 'phags blo gnyi ga / zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa nas lam la rjes su shes pa'i bar gyi shes rab de ni nye bar rtog par zhugs pa yang yin la /
translated: Therefore, they are not the nature of views.üîΩThe other, which is the knowledge of the noble ones, is both.

original: de'i yul can gyi the tshom spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i yul can gyi the tshom spangs pa yin no //
translated: The wisdom that is the knowledge of the dharma of suffering up to the subsequent knowledge of the path is both engaged in thorough investigation and it abandons doubt that has it as its object.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa ste /
translated: The other is mundane.

original: de ni thams cad shes pa yin no zhes nges par gzung bas shes pa ma yin pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni thams cad shes pa yin no zhes nges par gzung bas shes pa ma yin pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since it is ascertained that it is knowledge, it is said that there is no wisdom that is not knowledge.

original: shes rab de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that wisdom?

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga las byung ba dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / yid las byung ba lta ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga las byung ba dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa dang / yid las byung ba lta ba'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: The mental faculty is wholesome, unwholesome, nondetermined, and defiled, but not of the nature of view.

original: lta ba'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa dang / yid las byung ba dge ba gang yin pa de ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: lta ba'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa dang / yid las byung ba dge ba gang yin pa de ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of view? What is the wholesome mental faculty?

original: drug ni lta ba'ang yin zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: drug ni lta ba'ang yin zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Six are also view.

original: 'jig rten pa'i shes rab rnam pa de drug ni lta ba yin gyi drug kho na zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir gzhan ni lta ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i shes rab rnam pa de drug ni lta ba yin gyi drug kho na zhes nges par gzung ba'i phyir gzhan ni lta ba ma yin no //
translated: The six types of mundane wisdom are view. The other types of mental consciousness are not view.

original: gzhan yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang zhe na /
translated: What are the other types?

original: sngar bshad pa 'jig rten pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa 'jig rten pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Those that were previously explained as mundane.

original: 'di dang gzhan dag kyang shes pa ni yin no zhes bya ba ni lta ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi shes rab rnam pa drug po 'di dang / de las gzhan pa sngar bshad pa rnams kyang shes pa zhes ni bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dang gzhan dag kyang shes pa ni yin no zhes bya ba ni lta ba'i ngo bo nyid kyi shes rab rnam pa drug po 'di dang / de las gzhan pa sngar bshad pa rnams kyang shes pa zhes ni bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand the others are also knowledge‚Äù refers to the six types of wisdom that have the nature of view and the other types of wisdom that were previously explained.

original: gang gi phyir drug po 'di dag shes pa zhes kyang bya la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir drug po 'di dag shes pa zhes kyang bya la /
translated: All of them are called ‚Äúknowledge.‚Äù

original: lta ba zhes kyang bya ba de nyid kyi phyir drug ni lta ba 'ang yin zhes yang zhes bya ba'i sgra 'don to //
analyzed: lta ba zhes kyang bya ba de nyid kyi phyir drug ni lta ba 'ang yin zhes yang zhes bya ba'i sgra 'don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúand the others are also knowledge‚Äù indicates that the six types of wisdom that have the nature of view are also called ‚Äúknowledge.‚Äù

original: shes pa bcus zhes bya ba gang dag gis she na /
analyzed: shes pa bcus zhes bya ba gang dag gis she na /
translated: By how many of the ten types of knowledge are they known?

original: chos dang rjes dang kun rdzob dang // gzhan gyi sems dang @239b sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang / lam dang zad dang mi skye shes pa dag gis so //
analyzed: chos dang rjes dang kun rdzob dang // gzhan gyi sems dang @239b sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang / lam dang zad dang mi skye shes pa dag gis so //
translated: They are known by the ten types of knowledge: the knowledge of dharmas, subsequent knowledge, the conventional knowledge, the knowledge of the mind of another, the knowledge of suffering, the knowledge of origination, the knowledge of cessation, the knowledge of the path, the knowledge of destruction, and the knowledge of nonproduction.

original: shes pa bcu kho nar bshad pa 'di ni nges par gzung bar bya ba'i don yin te /
analyzed: shes pa bcu kho nar bshad pa 'di ni nges par gzung bar bya ba'i don yin te /
translated: The statement that they are known by ten types of knowledge is meant to be definitive.

original: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba dang / gang zag dang 'khor shes pa la sogs pa ni 'di dag kho na'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba dang skye ba dang / gang zag dang 'khor shes pa la sogs pa ni 'di dag kho na'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the knowledge of death and rebirth, the knowledge of the person, the knowledge of the wheel, and so on, are included in these knowledges.

original: mdor bsdu na ni gnyis te /üîΩshes pa zag bcas zag pa med //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na ni gnyis te / shes pa zag bcas zag pa med //
translated: In brief, there are two knowledges:

original: ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba yin no //
translated: defiled and undefiled.

original: phal cher zhes bya ba khyad par smos pa ni kun rdzob kyi shes pa phal cher bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa kun rdzob tu yod pa'i dngos po la dmigs kyi res 'ga' ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang 'dzin to //
analyzed: phal cher zhes bya ba khyad par smos pa ni kun rdzob kyi shes pa phal cher bum pa dang snam bu la sogs pa kun rdzob tu yod pa'i dngos po la dmigs kyi res 'ga' ni rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang 'dzin to //
translated: The word ‚Äúmostly‚Äù is used because conventional knowledge, for the most part, focuses on things that exist conventionally, such as a pot, cloth, etc., but sometimes it also grasps the specific and general characteristics of its object.

original: kun rdzob kyi zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob la 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob la 'byung ba'o //
translated: Conventional knowledge arises in relation to the conventional.üîΩUndefiled knowledge is also twofold in brief:

original: zag pa med pa yang mdor bsdu na chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa zhes bya ba gnyis te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa yang mdor bsdu na chos shes pa dang / rjes su shes pa zhes bya ba gnyis te /
translated: knowledge of the doctrine and subsequent knowledge.

original: sdug bsngal shes pa la sogs pa ni 'di dag kho na'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa la sogs pa ni 'di dag kho na'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the knowledge of suffering, etc., are included in these two.

original: dmigs pa ni ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni gang gis dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni de'i yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni gang gis dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni de'i yin te /
translated: because they focus on those.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni sgra ma yin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs pa ni sgra ma yin no //
translated: The object field of eye consciousness is not sound.üîΩBecause they focus on those means because they focus on suffering and so on.

original: de dag la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Those four are called knowledge of elimination and nonarising.üîΩThose four are called knowledge of elimination and nonarising.

original: rnam bzhi de dag ni zhes bya ba ni chos dang rjes su shes pa gnyis po lta ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa sdug bsngal la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi po de dag kho na zad pa shes pa dang /üîΩmi skye ba shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam bzhi de dag ni zhes bya ba ni chos dang rjes su shes pa gnyis po lta ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa sdug bsngal la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi po de dag kho na zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those four are called knowledge of elimination and nonarising because they are the four that are not the nature of view, that is, Dharma knowledge and subsequent knowledge, distinguished by their focal object of suffering and so on.üîΩThe first two knowledges of elimination and nonarisingüîΩare knowledge of suffering and origin and subsequent knowledge.

original: de gnyis dang po skyes pa ni zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pa de gnyis dang po skyes pa ni sdug bsngal rgyu rjes shes pa yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis dang po skyes pa ni zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pa de gnyis dang po skyes pa ni sdug bsngal rgyu rjes shes pa yin te /
translated: The first two knowledges of elimination and nonarising are knowledge of suffering and origin and subsequent knowledge.

original: gdon mi za bar sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la dmigs pa dag yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la dmigs pa dag yin no zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: It is definitely the case that they focus on the truths of suffering and origin.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i phung po la sdug bsngal lam kun 'byung ba la rjes su shes pa'i rnam par dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i phung po la sdug bsngal lam kun 'byung ba la rjes su shes pa'i rnam par dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because they focus on the aspects of the truth of suffering and origin that focus on the aggregates of the summit of existence.

original: 'di ltar zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dang po skyes pa de dag ni gdon mi za bar srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i phung po rnams la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa dang / rgyu la sogs pas kun 'byung ba'i rnam par dmigs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa dang po skyes pa de dag ni gdon mi za bar srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i phung po rnams la mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa dang / rgyu la sogs pas kun 'byung ba'i rnam par dmigs so //
translated: Thus the first knowledge of elimination and nonarising definitely focuses on the aspects of the truth of suffering such as impermanence and the aspects of the truth of origin such as cause in relation to the aggregates of the summit of existence.

original: dang por skyes pa ma yin pa de dag ni @240a * //
analyzed: dang por skyes pa ma yin pa de dag ni @240a * //
translated: But those that are not first generated

original: bden pa gzhan la dmigs pa dag kyang yin no zhes bya bar shugs kyis bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bden pa gzhan la dmigs pa dag kyang yin no zhes bya bar shugs kyis bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: are also those that focus on other truths.

original: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mjug thogs su zad pa shes pa 'byung la /
analyzed: rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin gyi mjug thogs su zad pa shes pa 'byung la /
translated: Knowledge of elimination arises after the vajra like concentration.

original: de'i rjes la mi skye ba shes pa 'byung ba de'i phyir ci rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin kyang de gnyis dang dmigs pa gcig pa zhig yin nam zhes 'dri ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes la mi skye ba shes pa 'byung ba de'i phyir ci rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin kyang de gnyis dang dmigs pa gcig pa zhig yin nam zhes 'dri ste /
translated: Therefore, one asks, ‚ÄúIs the vajra like concentration also the same as those two in having the same object?‚Äù

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don ni ji ltar zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dmigs pa gcig yin pa ltar /
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don ni ji ltar zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa dmigs pa gcig yin pa ltar /
translated: The meaning of the word also is that just as the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising have the same object,

original: ci rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin kyang de gnyis dang dmigs pa gcig pa zhig yin nam zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ci rdo rje lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin kyang de gnyis dang dmigs pa gcig pa zhig yin nam zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: is the vajra like concentration also the same as those two in having the same object?

original: de gnyis dang zhes bya ba ni dang po skyes pa dag dang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de gnyis dang zhes bya ba ni dang po skyes pa dag dang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Those two means those that first arose.

original: gal te sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la dmigs na ni yin no zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la dmigs na ni yin no zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: If it focuses on the truths of suffering and origin, then it is.

original: de gnyis dang dmigs pa gcig pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de gnyis dang dmigs pa gcig pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: What is it? It is the vajra like concentration that is the same as those two in having the same object.

original: 'on te 'gog pa dang lam la dmigs pa zhig yin na ni dmigs pa gcig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te 'gog pa dang lam la dmigs pa zhig yin na ni dmigs pa gcig pa ma yin te /
translated: But if it focuses on the truths of cessation and path, then it does not have the same object.

original: de gnyis ni nges par srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i phung po la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ni nges par srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i phung po la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Both of those are definitely focused on the aggregates of the summit of existence.

original: dper na dug mdas phog ste /üîΩshi ba'i dug yan lag thams cad la khyab nas shi ba'i tshe rma'i phyogs kho nar gnas kyi gzhan du ma yin pa de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa 'di'i shes pa de dag kyang spang bar bya ba srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i phung po'i mtshan nyid kho na
analyzed: dper na dug mdas phog ste / shi ba'i dug yan lag thams cad la khyab nas shi ba'i tshe rma'i phyogs kho nar gnas kyi gzhan du ma yin pa de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa 'di'i shes pa de dag kyang spang bar bya ba srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i phung po'i mtshan nyid kho na
translated: For example, when a poisoned arrow strikes,üîΩthe poison spreads throughout the body and when one dies, it does not remain in the area of the wound alone, but is everywhere.

original: la gnas so //üîΩbzhi las pha rol sems rig pa /
analyzed: la gnas so // bzhi las pha rol sems rig pa /
translated: Similarly, the consciousnesses of these yogis remain in the aggregates of the summit of existence alone, which are objects to be abandoned.üîΩKnowledge of others' minds is derived from four.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos shes pa la sogs pa bzhi kho na las yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos shes pa la sogs pa bzhi kho na las yin te /
translated: Knowledge of others' minds is derived from four knowledges: Dharma knowledge and so on,

original: de dag gis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is subsumed by those.

original: sdug bsngal shes pa la sogs pa las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa la sogs pa las ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not derived from the knowledge of suffering and so on,

original: gzhan gyi rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it has the aspect of another.

original: ; gzhan gyi sems shes pa zag pa med pa ni lam shes pa yin pa'i phyir lam gyi rnam pa can kho na yin no //
analyzed: ; gzhan gyi sems shes pa zag pa med pa ni lam shes pa yin pa'i phyir lam gyi rnam pa can kho na yin no //
translated: Uncontaminated knowledge of others' minds is derived from the knowledge of the path alone, because it has the aspect of the path.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang // 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya bar 'jig rten pa'i rnam pa can yin no //üîΩdad pas mos pa dang dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis zhes bya ba ni grangs bzhin du dad pas mos pa'i lam gyis mthong bas thob pa'i lam mi shes la /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang // 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya bar 'jig rten pa'i rnam pa can yin no // dad pas mos pa dang dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis zhes bya ba ni grangs bzhin du dad pas mos pa'i lam gyis mthong bas thob pa'i lam mi shes la /
translated: That which is contaminated is known as associated with attachment and free from attachment, in the manner of mundane cognition.

original: dus kyis rnam par grol ba'i lam gyis dus dang mi sbyar bar rnam bar grol ba'i lam mi shes so //üîΩ'og mas gong ma zhes bya ba ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i @240b lam gyis dgra bcom pa'i lam mi shes la /

translated: The aspect of the cognition of phenomena, subsequent cognition, the truth of suffering, origin, cessation, and path that is possessed by the knowledge of elimination is the aspect of the knowledge of elimination that is possessed by the knowledge of nonarising.üîΩThe aspect of the cognition of phenomena, subsequent cognition, the truth of suffering, origin, cessation, and path that is possessed by the knowledge of nonarising is the aspect of the knowledge of nonarising that is possessed by the knowledge of nonarising.üîΩThe aspect of the cognition of phenomena, subsequent cognition, the truth of suffering, origin, cessation, and path that is possessed by the knowledge of elimination is the aspect of the knowledge of elimination that is possessed by the knowledge of nonarising.

analyzed: kha cig na re mdo 'dir ni zhe sdang dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems ni zhe sdang dang bcas pa yin la /
translated: Some say: In this sutra, a mind that is concomitant with aversion is associated with aversion.

original: zhe sdang gi gnyen po ni zhe sdang dang bral bar bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi gnyen po ni zhe sdang dang bral bar bshad pa yin te /
translated: The antidote to hatred is the mind free from hatred.

original: gal te zhe sdang dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa zhe sdang dang bral ba yin na ni nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang yin par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gal te zhe sdang dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa zhe sdang dang bral ba yin na ni nyon mongs pa gzhan dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang yin par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: If the mind is free from hatred when it is not associated with hatred, then it would also be free from hatred when it is associated with other afflictions.

original: gzhan dag na re de lta na ni 'o na de'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i sems nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa zhe sdang dang bcas pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re de lta na ni 'o na de'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i sems nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa zhe sdang dang bcas pa ma yin la /
translated: Others say: In that case, a non-afflicted mind that is not an antidote to hatred would not be associated with hatred.üîΩAnd it would not be free from hatred.

original: zhe sdang dang bral ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du gti mug dang bcas pa'i sems kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang bral ba yang ma yin zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du gti mug dang bcas pa'i sems kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: And so on should be applied to a mind associated with delusion.

original: de lta bas na 'dir 'dod chags dang ldan pas kyang 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems su 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir 'dod chags dang ldan pas kyang 'dod chags dang bcas pa'i sems su 'dod par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, here, a mind possessing attachment is asserted to be associated with attachment.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pas kyang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pas kyang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The word also indicates that it is also associated with attachment.

original: gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba'i bar du yang de dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o zhes @245b bya ba ni de lta bas na mdo 'dir zhe sdang dang ldan pas kyang zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang ldan pas kyang gti mug dang bcas par 'dod par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gti mug dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang bral ba'i bar du yang de dang 'dra bar shes par bya'o zhes @245b bya ba ni de lta bas na mdo 'dir zhe sdang dang ldan pas kyang zhe sdang dang bcas pa dang / gti mug dang ldan pas kyang gti mug dang bcas par 'dod par bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this sutra, it should be understood that those with hatred are associated with hatred, and those with delusion are associated with delusion.

original: dmigs pa la mngon par sdud pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i sems ni rnam par g-yeng ba dang mtshungs par mi ldan te /
analyzed: dmigs pa la mngon par sdud pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i sems ni rnam par g-yeng ba dang mtshungs par mi ldan te /
translated: Because it is concentrated on the object means that a virtuous mind is not concomitant with distraction.

original: de lta bas na de'i dmigs pa la de mngon par sdud pas kun du bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i dmigs pa la de mngon par sdud pas kun du bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is concentrated on its object, it is concentrated.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi gnyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi gnyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnyid ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Because it is concomitant with defiled sleep means that sleep is of two kinds:

original: nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: defiled and undefiled.

original: sems de nyid nyon mongs pa can gyi gnyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir bsdus pa yang yin la /
analyzed: sems de nyid nyon mongs pa can gyi gnyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir bsdus pa yang yin la /
translated: and because that mind is concomitant with afflicted sleep, it would be both contracted and distracted, because it is afflicted.üîΩThis is the fault of confusion.

original: nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir rnam par g-yeng ba yang yin bar 'gyur bar 'chol ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir rnam par g-yeng ba yang yin bar 'gyur bar 'chol ba'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: And it would contradict the treatise.üîΩHow does it contradict the treatise?

original: bstan bcos dang 'gal bar yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: bstan bcos dang 'gal bar yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ji lta zhe na /
translated: The treatise states:

original: sems kun du bsdus pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so zhes rgyas par ji skad du 'grel pa'i nad du bris pa lta bu yin no //üîΩde dag las re zhig rjes su shes pa ni kun du bsdus pa'i sems la dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems kun du bsdus pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so zhes rgyas par ji skad du 'grel pa'i nad du bris pa lta bu yin no // de dag las re zhig rjes su shes pa ni kun du bsdus pa'i sems la dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: One accurately knows contracted minds, etc.

original: 'dod pa'i khams las yan chad na gnyid med pa'i phyir dang / rjes su shes pa yang 'dod pa'i khams la mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams las yan chad na gnyid med pa'i phyir dang / rjes su shes pa yang 'dod pa'i khams la mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among those, subsequent knowledge does not focus on a contracted mind because sleep does not exist above the desire realm and because subsequent knowledge does not focus on the desire realm.

original: lam la shes pa yang kun du bsdus pa la dmigs par mi srid de /
analyzed: lam la shes pa yang kun du bsdus pa la dmigs par mi srid de /
translated: Knowledge of the truth of path is not possible as a focus of a contracted mind because it is not possible for a single mindstream to possess both the uncontaminated and contaminated.

original: lam shes pa ni lam la dmigs pa yin la lam gyis bsdus pa'i sems kyang gnyid dang mtshungs par mi ldan pas so //
analyzed: lam shes pa ni lam la dmigs pa yin la lam gyis bsdus pa'i sems kyang gnyid dang mtshungs par mi ldan pas so //
translated: Knowledge of the path focuses on the path, but the mind subsumed by the path is not concomitant with sleep.

original: des na 'di skad du de shes pa'i shes pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: des na 'di skad du de shes pa'i shes pa ni gnyis te /
translated: Therefore it is said that the knowledge that knows that is two:

original: chos shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa'o zhes brjod dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa'o zhes brjod dgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: knowledge of the truth of Dharma and conventional knowledge.

original: gang dag na re kun du bsdus pa'i shes pa ni dmigs pa la mngon par sdud pa'i phyir dge ba yin no zhes zer ba de dag gi ltar na nyes pa 'di gnyis su mi 'gyur te /üîΩde ni nyon mongs pa can gyi gnyid dang mtshungs par mi ldan pas bsdus pa yang yin la /
analyzed: gang dag na re kun du bsdus pa'i shes pa ni dmigs pa la mngon par sdud pa'i phyir dge ba yin no zhes zer ba de dag gi ltar na nyes pa 'di gnyis su mi 'gyur te / de ni nyon mongs pa can gyi gnyid dang mtshungs par mi ldan pas bsdus pa yang yin la /
translated: Those who say that the contracted mind is virtuous because it focuses on its object would not commit these two errors.

original: rnam par g-yengs pa yang yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par g-yengs pa yang yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That mind is not concomitant with afflicted sleep and it would not be distracted.

original: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba yang med de /
analyzed: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba yang med de /
translated: There is also no contradiction with the treatise.

original: kun du bsdus ba'i sems dge ba ni khams gsum gyis bsdus pa dang ma bsdus pa yin pas de shes pa'i shes pa ni bzhi zhes bya ba 'grub ste /
analyzed: kun du bsdus ba'i sems dge ba ni khams gsum gyis bsdus pa dang ma bsdus pa yin pas de shes pa'i shes pa ni bzhi zhes bya ba 'grub ste /
translated: The virtuous contracted mind is subsumed by the three realms and not subsumed by the three realms. Therefore it is established that the knowledge that knows that is four:üîΩknowledge of the truth of Dharma, subsequent knowledge, knowledge of the path and conventional knowledge.

original: gzugs dang @246a * //
analyzed: gzugs dang @246a * //
translated: FormüîΩ

original: gzugs med pa'i sems dge ba la dmigs pa zag pa med pa'i shes pa ni rjes su shes pa yin la /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i sems dge ba la dmigs pa zag pa med pa'i shes pa ni rjes su shes pa yin la /
translated: The uncontaminated knowledge that focuses on virtuous minds of the form realm and formless realm is subsequent knowledge.

original: lam gyis bsdus pa'i sems dge ba la dmigs pa ni lam shes pa yang yin no //
analyzed: lam gyis bsdus pa'i sems dge ba la dmigs pa ni lam shes pa yang yin no //
translated: Knowledge of the truth of the path is knowledge that focuses on virtuous minds subsumed by the path.

original: rnam par byang ba chung ngu dag gis bsten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dge ba chung ngu dag gis bsten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba chung ngu dag gis bsten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dge ba chung ngu dag gis bsten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because they are cultivated by those of small purification means that they are cultivated by those of small virtue.

original: de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par byang ba chen po dag gis bsten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par byang ba chen po dag gis bsten pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because they are the opposite of that means because they are cultivated by those of great purification.üîΩThe root, price, and so on are small and greatüîΩbecause they are cultivated by those of small and great virtue.

original: rtsa ba dang rin dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rtsa ba la sogs pa stob sa la thug pa rnams re re zhing chung ba dang che ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: rtsa ba dang rin dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni rtsa ba la sogs pa stob sa la thug pa rnams re re zhing chung ba dang che ba nyid yin te /
translated: The root, price, and so on, up to the end of the earth are small and great because they are cultivated by those of small and great virtue.

original: rtsa ba nyung ba dang mang ba'i phyir go rims bzhin du chung ngu dang chen por gyur pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba nyung ba dang mang ba'i phyir go rims bzhin du chung ngu dang chen por gyur pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: They are small or great, respectively, because they have few or many roots.

original: ji lta zhe na /üîΩsmras pa nyon mongs pa can mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gnyis pa gti mug dang chags pa dang zhe sdang dag las gang yang rung ba zhig gis rtsa ba dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na / smras pa nyon mongs pa can mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gnyis pa gti mug dang chags pa dang zhe sdang dag las gang yang rung ba zhig gis rtsa ba dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: How so?

original: tshogs pa gcig la de gnyis 'du ba med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdge ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum po ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang gti mug med pa dag gis te /
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig la de gnyis 'du ba med pa'i phyir ro // dge ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum po ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang gti mug med pa dag gis te /
translated: They are associated with two roots, either delusion, attachment, or aversion, because two of these roots do not coexist.

original: 'di rnams ni med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams ni med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are associated with three roots, because the three roots of virtue nonattachment, nonaversion, and nondelusion exist when they are virtuous.üîΩThey are not associated with roots that are neither virtuous nor nonvirtuous, because they are not concomitant with them.

original: de dang 'dra ba ma 'ongs pa thob pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lugs kyi dge ba'i chos 'dus byas dag 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin pas nyon mongs pa can dang 'dra ba ma 'ongs pa thob cing rnyed pa ni med pa'i phyir
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba ma 'ongs pa thob pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni lugs kyi dge ba'i chos 'dus byas dag 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin pas nyon mongs pa can dang 'dra ba ma 'ongs pa thob cing rnyed pa ni med pa'i phyir
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause there is no obtainment of a future state similar to that‚Äù means that there is no obtainment or acquisition of a future state that is similar to a past or present afflicted state.

original: ro // phung po gsum gyis rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi phung po rnams so //
analyzed: ro // phung po gsum gyis rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi phung po rnams so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is accompanied by three aggregates‚Äù means that it is accompanied by the aggregates of feeling, perception, and formation.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung pos ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung pos ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not accompanied by the aggregate of consciousness,

original: tshogs pa gcig la rnam par shes pa gnyis pa med pa dang / bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid la byed pa yang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa gcig la rnam par shes pa gnyis pa med pa dang / bdag nyid kyis bdag nyid la byed pa yang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because two consciousnesses do not occur in the same group and because it is contradictory for something to act upon itself.

original: dge ba ni de dang 'dra ba ma 'ongs pa thob pa yod pa'i phyir 'khor ba mang ba yin la /
analyzed: dge ba ni de dang 'dra ba ma 'ongs pa thob pa yod pa'i phyir 'khor ba mang ba yin la /
translated: Since there is obtainment of a future state that is similar to a virtuous state, it is said that virtuous states are more numerous in terms of their retinue.

original: phung po bzhi po tshor ba la sogs pa gsum po de dag gzugs kyi phung po bsam gtan dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa /
analyzed: phung po bzhi po tshor ba la sogs pa gsum po de dag gzugs kyi phung po bsam gtan dang / zag pa med pa'i sdom pas bsdus pa /
translated: The four aggregates of feeling and so on are concomitant with the form aggregate that is subsumed by the absorptions and uncontaminated vows.

original: sems kyi rjes su 'brang bas ci rigs par rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa yin no //üîΩyang nyon mongs pa can ni stobs chung ba yin no zhes bya ba dge ba yang log @246b bar lta ba'i skad cig ma gcig gis dge ba'i phung po lnga 'joms pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems kyi rjes su 'brang bas ci rigs par rjes su 'brang ba dang bcas pa yin no // yang nyon mongs pa can ni stobs chung ba yin no zhes bya ba dge ba yang log @246b bar lta ba'i skad cig ma gcig gis dge ba'i phung po lnga 'joms pa'i phyir /
translated: They are also concomitant with the form aggregate that is subsumed by the absorptions and uncontaminated vows.üîΩAgain, afflicted states are weak.

original: stobs chung ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: stobs chung ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Since a single moment of wrong view destroys the five virtuous aggregates, are not virtuous states also weak?

original: de ni gtan du 'chad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni gtan du 'chad pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not permanently destroyed,

original: yang mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are again connected.

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas ni phra rgyas bcu po gtan du gcod do //üîΩde'i phyir yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas ni phra rgyas bcu po gtan du gcod do // de'i phyir yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering completely destroys the ten entanglements.üîΩAgain, the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering completely destroys the ten entanglements.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sngar bshad pa'i phyir yang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sngar bshad pa'i phyir yang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Again refers to the previously explained ten entanglements.

original: de'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgod pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgod pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is the antidote to that means because it is the antidote to agitation.

original: rnam par ma zhi ba dang / rnam par zhi ba yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par ma zhi ba ni rgod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can yin la /
analyzed: rnam par ma zhi ba dang / rnam par zhi ba yang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par ma zhi ba ni rgod pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can yin la /
translated: The same applies to non-pacification and pacification. Non-pacification is defiled because it is associated with agitation.

original: rnam par zhi ba ni de'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dge ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par zhi ba ni de'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dge ba yin no //
translated: Pacification is virtuous because it is the antidote to that.

original: yang na de ni nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i sgo nas nye bar zhi ba dang nye bar zhi pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na de ni nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i sgo nas nye bar zhi ba dang nye bar zhi pa yin no //
translated: Alternatively, it is pacification and complete pacification from the point of view of being associated and not being associated with the defilements.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa ni de'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dge ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa ni de'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dge ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par g-yeng ba'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is virtuous because it is the antidote to distraction.

original: 'thob pa dang bsten pa'i bsgom pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni sngon ma thob pa las 'thob pa ni 'thob ba'o //
analyzed: 'thob pa dang bsten pa'i bsgom pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni sngon ma thob pa las 'thob pa ni 'thob ba'o //
translated: Obtaining is obtaining what was not previously obtained.

original: mngon du byed pa ni bsten pa'o //
analyzed: mngon du byed pa ni bsten pa'o //
translated: Practice is making it present.

original: de dag nyid bsgom pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag nyid bsgom pa yin te /
translated: Those are themselves cultivation.

original: ma bsgoms pa ni de dag gis ma bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma bsgoms pa ni de dag gis ma bsgoms pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is not cultivated is not cultivated by them.

original: nyon mongs pa can ni dge ba bzhin du ma 'ongs pa thob pa yang med la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ni dge ba bzhin du ma 'ongs pa thob pa yang med la /
translated: The afflicted does not obtain the future, like the virtuous.

original: dman pa'i phyir bsten par 'os pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dman pa'i phyir bsten par 'os pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not worthy of practice because it is inferior.

original: 'thob dang bsten ces bya ba ni dge ba 'dus byas 'thob pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'thob dang bsten ces bya ba ni dge ba 'dus byas 'thob pa'o zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Obtaining and practicing are the obtaining of conditioned virtue.

original: de gnyis kyis zhes bya ba ni 'thob pa dang bsten pa'i bsgom pa dag gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis zhes bya ba ni 'thob pa dang bsten pa'i bsgom pa dag gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Those two is the cultivation through obtaining and the cultivation through practice.

original: rang bzhin dang rgyud rnam par grol ba dag gis rnam par ma grol ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rang bzhin rnam par grol bas kyang rnam par grol ba ma yin la /
analyzed: rang bzhin dang rgyud rnam par grol ba dag gis rnam par ma grol ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir rang bzhin rnam par grol bas kyang rnam par grol ba ma yin la /
translated: They are not liberated by nature, because they are associated with the defilements.

original: nyon mongs pa zad pa'i rgyud la mi skye ba'i phyir rgyud rnam par grol bas kyang rnam par grol ba ma yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa zad pa'i rgyud la mi skye ba'i phyir rgyud rnam par grol bas kyang rnam par grol ba ma yin no //
translated: They are not liberated by lineage, because they do not arise in the life-stream that has exhausted the defilements.

original: rnam par grol ba ni nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa zad pa'i rgyud la skye ba'i phyir dge ba yin no //üîΩrmugs pa dad gnyid dang lhan cig @247a * //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ni nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa zad pa'i rgyud la skye ba'i phyir dge ba yin no // rmugs pa dad gnyid dang lhan cig @247a * //
translated: Liberation is wholesome, because it is not associated with the defilements and because it arises in the life-stream that has exhausted the defilements.üîΩIt is said that torpor is associated with sleep.

original: par gyur zhes bya ba ni rmugs pa dang gnyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
analyzed: par gyur zhes bya ba ni rmugs pa dang gnyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o //
translated: It is associated with sleep, because it is associated with sleep.

original: lhag mthong dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa zhes bya ba ni nang du kun du 'gog pa dang lhan cig par gyur zhes bya ba de kho na ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag mthong dang mtshungs par mi ldan pa zhes bya ba ni nang du kun du 'gog pa dang lhan cig par gyur zhes bya ba de kho na ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúnot associated with insight‚Äù indicates that it is associated with internal cessation.

original: rnam par 'phros pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su g-yengs pa zhes bya ba 'di'i bshad pa yin no //üîΩnyon mongs pa can gyi gnyid dang lhan cig par gyur ba rnam par g-yengs pa nyid du dam ma bcas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ci'i phyir 'di la rnam par g-yengs pa nyid du yin par dam mi 'cha'/üîΩci nyon mongs pa can gyi sems gnyid dang lhan cig par gyur pa la rnam par g-yengs ba nyid med pas dam mi 'cha' 'am 'on te 'di la rnam par g-yengs ba nyid yod mod kyi kun du bsdus pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir dam mi
