analyzed: pha rol gyi rgyud ces smos pa ni rang gi rgyud gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The words mindstream of others are stated in order to exclude one's own mindstream.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang ldan pa dang / ldan pa ma yin pa zhes smos pa ni gzugs med pa dang ldan pa dgag pa'i phyir ro //üîΩmthong ba'i lam bkag pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa na gzhan gyi sems shes pa mngon du mi byed pas de'i phyir mthong ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa med de /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs dang ldan pa dang / ldan pa ma yin pa zhes smos pa ni gzugs med pa dang ldan pa dgag pa'i phyir ro // mthong ba'i lam bkag pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam la gnas pa na gzhan gyi sems shes pa mngon du mi byed pas de'i phyir mthong ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa med de /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúassociated with the desire realm and the form realm‚Äù is stated in order to exclude the possibility that it is associated with the formless realm.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúit is not included in the path of seeing‚Äù means that the knowledge of others‚Äô minds is not made manifest by one who is established in the path of seeing.

original: mthong ba'i lam ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnam par chad pa la dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnam par chad pa la dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not included in the path of seeing, because the path of seeing does not take as its object the disjunction of the mind and mental factors.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is included in the path of meditation‚Äù means that it is included in the path of meditation.

original: stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang mi ldan pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin dang / mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang mi ldan pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is not associated with the emptiness or the absence of characteristics‚Äù means that it is not associated with the concentration on emptiness or the concentration on the absence of characteristics.

original: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin ni sdug bsngal shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi ting nge 'dzin ni sdug bsngal shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan la /
translated: The concentration of emptiness is concomitant with the knowledge of suffering.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni 'gog pa shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin na /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni 'gog pa shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin na /
translated: The concentration of signlessness is concomitant with the knowledge of cessation.üîΩSince the knowledge of others' minds does not have the same aspect or focal object, it is not the knowledge of suffering or the knowledge of cessation.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni rnam pa dang dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir sdug bsngal shes pa'am 'gog pa shes pa ma yin pas de gnyis dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni rnam pa dang dmigs pa tha dad pa'i phyir sdug bsngal shes pa'am 'gog pa shes pa ma yin pas de gnyis dang mi ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is said that it is not concomitant with those two.

original: shugs kyis na smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni srid do zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shugs kyis na smon pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang mtshungs par ldan pa ni srid do zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: By implication, it is said that it is possible that it is concomitant with the concentration of wishlessness.

original: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pas ma bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pas ma bsdus pa ste /üîΩzad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i @251a * //
analyzed: zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pas ma bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pas ma bsdus pa ste / zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i @251a * //
translated: It is not subsumed by the knowledge of elimination and nonarising means it is not subsumed by the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising.üîΩIt is not the entity of the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonarising.

original: ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa dang / kun du rtog pa dang yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa can yin na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni rdzas kyi rang gi mtshan nyid la dmigs pa dang / kun du rtog pa dang yongs su tshol ba'i bsam pa can yin na /
translated: The knowledge of others' minds has as its object the substance of its own characteristics, and it has the attitude of thorough examination and investigation.

original: zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pa ni de lta bu ma yin pas de gnyis kyis ma bsdus so //
analyzed: zad pa shes pa dang mi skye ba shes pa ni de lta bu ma yin pas de gnyis kyis ma bsdus so //
translated: The knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonproduction do not have that kind of object, and therefore they are not included in those two.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam bkag pa zhes bya ba ni de'i spong ba'i lam yin la /
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam bkag pa zhes bya ba ni de'i spong ba'i lam yin la /
translated: The phrase the uninterrupted path is excluded means that the path of elimination is not included in the knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of nonproduction.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni rnam par grol ba dang khyad par gyi lam yin pas so //üîΩdon dam pa dag yin yang kun rdzob la brten pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa 'am /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni rnam par grol ba dang khyad par gyi lam yin pas so // don dam pa dag yin yang kun rdzob la brten pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa 'am /
translated: The knowledge of others' minds is the path of liberation and the special path.üîΩAlthough they are ultimate, they are based on the conventional.

original: don dam pas rtsen pa'i phyir don dam pa dag go //
analyzed: don dam pas rtsen pa'i phyir don dam pa dag go //
translated: They are ultimate because they are characterized by the ultimate, or because they play in the ultimate.

original: de gnyis kun rdzob la brten pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de gnyis kun rdzob la brten pa'i phyir te /
translated: They are based on the conventional because

original: gang gi phyir 'di dag kun rdzob la brten pa de'i phyir stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa can dag med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di dag kun rdzob la brten pa de'i phyir stong pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa can dag med do //
translated: they are based on the conventional. Therefore they do not have the aspects of emptiness and selflessness.

original: ji ltar 'di dag kun rdzob la brten ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di dag kun rdzob la brten ce na /
translated: How are these based on the conventional?

original: bdag gi skye ba zad do /
analyzed: bdag gi skye ba zad do /
translated: ‚ÄúMy births have been exhausted.üîΩI will know no existence other than this.‚Äù

original: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba yin te go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba yin te go rims bzhin no //
translated: They are, respectively.

original: 'di dag zag pa med pa yin na ji ltar de lta bu'i rnam pa can dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag zag pa med pa yin na ji ltar de lta bu'i rnam pa can dag yin zhe na /
translated: If these are uncontaminated, how can they have such aspects?

original: de dag gi stobs kyis rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i sgo nas te /
analyzed: de dag gi stobs kyis rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa'i sgo nas te /
translated: They are so through the power of conventional knowledge that subsequently designates them.

original: shes pa gzhan gyis zhes bya ba tshig lhag ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyis zhes bya ba tshig lhag ma yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúby another knowledge‚Äù is a remainder from above.

original: gang gi phyir de dag gi rjes las skyes pa kun rdzob kyi shes pa de dag de lta bu'i rnam pa can du 'jug pa de'i phyir de dag gi rgyu mthun pas de gnyis kun rdzob la brten pa zhes bya'i de gnyis dngos su kun rdzob la brten
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag gi rjes las skyes pa kun rdzob kyi shes pa de dag de lta bu'i rnam pa can du 'jug pa de'i phyir de dag gi rgyu mthun pas de gnyis kun rdzob la brten pa zhes bya'i de gnyis dngos su kun rdzob la brten
translated: Because conventional knowledge that arises subsequently to them engages objects in such aspects, these two are said to be based on the conventional, since they are homogeneous with that.

original: pa ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: pa ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: They are not directly based on the conventional.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rgyu mthun pas de nyid bdag tu lta ba la brten pa kho nar 'jug pa'i phyir stod pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa ma gtogs pa rnam pa bcu bzhi dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rgyu mthun pas de nyid bdag tu lta ba la brten pa kho nar 'jug pa'i phyir stod pa dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa ma gtogs pa rnam pa bcu bzhi dang mtshungs par ldan pa dag yin no //
translated: Because it is just that which is engaged by the view of self through natural outcome, it is associated with the fourteen aspects, excluding the aspects of emptiness and selflessness.

original: mi ldan pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pas so //
analyzed: mi ldan pa'i sems kyis zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pas so //
translated: By a non-associated mind means by a non-contaminated mind.

original: rigs pas bskyed pa'i sgo nas shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log par shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rigs pas bskyed pa'i sgo nas shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log par shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is understood through reasoning means it is understood without error.

original: 'di ni gnas yod do //
analyzed: 'di ni gnas yod do //
translated: This is a possibility.

original: 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes bya ba ni 'di gnyis kyang zag pa med pa'i rnam pa yin te /üîΩ'di ni gnas yod do zhes bya ba ni 'di ni mtshan nyid yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes bya ba ni 'di gnyis kyang zag pa med pa'i rnam pa yin te / 'di ni gnas yod do zhes bya ba ni 'di ni mtshan nyid yod do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is a basis means these two are also uncontaminated aspects.üîΩThis is a possibility means this has a characteristic.

original: 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes bya ba ni 'di ni rgyu yod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes bya ba ni 'di ni rgyu yod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is a basis means this has a cause.

original: @251b 'di'i don ni 'di ma yin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ngag gam tshig gnyis po 'di yin te /üîΩgal te 'di ni gnas yod do //üîΩ'di ni gzhi yod do zhes bya ba mi rtag pa la sogs par shes par 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di ni srid do //
analyzed: @251b 'di'i don ni 'di ma yin zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ngag gam tshig gnyis po 'di yin te / gal te 'di ni gnas yod do // 'di ni gzhi yod do zhes bya ba mi rtag pa la sogs par shes par 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di ni srid do //
translated: The meaning of this is not so, etc.

original: 'di ni rigs so zhes bya ba yin no zhes bya bar 'dod na de ni gzhan nas mi 'byung ba'i phyir mi rung ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rigs so zhes bya ba yin no zhes bya bar 'dod na de ni gzhan nas mi 'byung ba'i phyir mi rung ste /
translated: If you maintain that the two statements, ‚ÄúThis is possible‚Äù and ‚ÄúThis is reasonable,‚Äù refer to the knowledge that ‚Äúthis impermanence, etc. exists,‚Äù then that is not reasonable, because those two statements are not found elsewhere.

original: tshig gzhan nas tshig de gnyis mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig gzhan nas tshig de gnyis mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Those two statements are not found in any other text.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúabandoned by the path of seeing‚Äù means the aspect of the truths that is abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa'i sgo nas shes par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log tu shes par 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin pas bskyed pa'i sgo nas shes par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log tu shes par 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúarises from an unreasonable cause‚Äù means that it is known through a distorted form of knowledge.

original: bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyis so //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems kyis so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin relation to the self and entities connected to the self‚Äù means in relation to the mind that is associated with the afflicted view of the self.

original: chad pa dang rtag pa zhes bya ba ni mthar 'dzin pa'i lta bas so //
analyzed: chad pa dang rtag pa zhes bya ba ni mthar 'dzin pa'i lta bas so //
translated: The terms annihilation and eternality are due to the view of grasping extremes.

original: rgyu med pa dang byed pa med pa dang skur pa 'debs pa zhes bya ba ni log par lta bas so //
analyzed: rgyu med pa dang byed pa med pa dang skur pa 'debs pa zhes bya ba ni log par lta bas so //
translated: The terms causeless and unproduced are due to wrong views.

original: mchog dang gtso bo dang khyad par du 'phags pa dang / dam pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: mchog dang gtso bo dang khyad par du 'phags pa dang / dam pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pas so //
translated: The terms supreme, best, distinguished, and excellent are due to the view of holding to an extreme.

original: dag pa dang grol ba dang nges par 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas so //
analyzed: dag pa dang grol ba dang nges par 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas so //
translated: The terms purification, liberation, and escape are due to the view of holding to a discipline and ritual as essential.

original: nem nur dang yid gnyis dang the tshom zhes bya ba ni the tshom gyis so //
analyzed: nem nur dang yid gnyis dang the tshom zhes bya ba ni the tshom gyis so //
translated: The terms doubt, uncertainty, and hesitation are due to doubt.

original: chags pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyis so //üîΩsdang ba zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gis so //
analyzed: chags pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyis so // sdang ba zhes bya ba ni zhe sdang gis so //
translated: The term attachment is due to craving.üîΩThe term aversion is due to hostility.

original: rlom pa zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal gyis so //
analyzed: rlom pa zhes bya ba ni nga rgyal gyis so //
translated: The term conceit is due to pride.

original: rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni gti mug gis so //
analyzed: rmongs pa zhes bya ba ni gti mug gis so //
translated: The term delusion is due to ignorance.

original: der yang 'di skad du 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: der yang 'di skad du 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If it were to occur in this way, it would be like this:

original: de skad kyang mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: de skad kyang mi 'byung ste /
translated: But this is not the case.

original: de'i phyir de'i don ni 'di ma yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i don ni 'di ma yin no zhes bya bar shes so //
translated: Therefore, we understand that this is not the meaning of the sutra.

original: rdzas su bdun yin zhes bya bar ni kha cig gi gzhung lugs kyis rdzas su sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa bzhi dang kun 'byung ba la sogs pa rnam pa re re ste bdun yin no //
analyzed: rdzas su bdun yin zhes bya bar ni kha cig gi gzhung lugs kyis rdzas su sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa bzhi dang kun 'byung ba la sogs pa rnam pa re re ste bdun yin no //
translated: Some believe that the truths are seven in substance, since there are four aspects of suffering and one aspect each of origination,üîΩcessation and path.üîΩThe aspect of cause is also the aspect of origination, appearance and condition, so they are merely synonyms and not distinct.

original: rgyu'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen kyang yin pas rnam grangs tsam du zad kyi khyad par ni med de dper na dbang po dang brgya byin dang khyer 'jig ces bya ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i rnam pa gang yin pa de ni kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu skye ba dang / rkyen kyang yin pas rnam grangs tsam du zad kyi khyad par ni med de dper na dbang po dang brgya byin dang khyer 'jig ces bya ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, this is like the terms indriya, ≈õakra and paururava.

original: de bzhin du 'gog pa nyid zhi ba dang gya nom pa dang nges par 'byung ba yin pas rnam pa gcig yin la /üîΩlam nyid kyang rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par @252a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gog pa nyid zhi ba dang gya nom pa dang nges par 'byung ba yin pas rnam pa gcig yin la / lam nyid kyang rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par @252a * //
translated: Similarly, cessation is one aspect, since it is peace, sublime and definitive release.

original: 'byin pa yin pas rnam pa gcig yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: 'byin pa yin pas rnam pa gcig yin no zhes zer te /
translated: The path is one aspect, since it is logical, a vehicle and definitiveüîΩemancipation.

original: des na 'di skad du rnal 'byor pas sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa ni bzhir mngon du byed la rgyu la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni gcig tu mngon du byed do zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'di skad du rnal 'byor pas sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa ni bzhir mngon du byed la rgyu la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni gcig tu mngon du byed do zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore this is said: Yogis and yoginis manifest the aspects of suffering in four ways and manifest the aspects of origin and so on in one way.üîΩVaibhasikas say: There are sixteen aspects in terms of substance because all aspects of origin and so on must be manifested individually, like the aspects of suffering.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni rdzas su rnam pa bcu drug go zhes brjod de sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa bzhin du kun 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyang so sor mngon du bya dgos pa'i phyir rnams rnams ni shes rab kyi ngo boüîΩnyid yin pas so zhes zer ro //üîΩrkyen la rag las pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mi rtag pa ni rkyen la rag las pa'i phyir nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams ni rdzas su rnam pa bcu drug go zhes brjod de sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa bzhin du kun 'byung ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa thams cad kyang so sor mngon du bya dgos pa'i phyir rnams rnams ni shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas so zhes zer ro // rkyen la rag las pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni mi rtag pa ni rkyen la rag las pa'i phyir nges pa ma yin te /
translated: The aspects are the essence of wisdom.üîΩBecause they depend on conditions and so on is an extensive explanation. Impermanence is not definite because it depends on conditions.

original: rkyen la rag las te skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rkyen la rag las te skye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that because it arises in dependence on conditions, it is not definite.

original: gnod pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnod par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnod pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gnod par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because it has the nature of harm means because it has the nature of harming.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zhes bya ba ni gnyen pos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zhes bya ba ni gnyen pos zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Adverse factors means antidotes.

original: 'gal ba'i phyogs ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pas so //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyogs ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pas so //
translated: Adverse factors are adverse because they are opposed.

original: sa bon gyi chos kyi tshul gyi rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni thag ring po'i gnas skabs kyi rgyu ston par byed de /
analyzed: sa bon gyi chos kyi tshul gyi rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni thag ring po'i gnas skabs kyi rgyu ston par byed de /
translated: The cause that is the mode of seed refers to the cause of the distant state.

original: dang po'i sa bon lta bu'o //
analyzed: dang po'i sa bon lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the initial seed.

original: tshul zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'dir lugs kyi don yin no //
analyzed: tshul zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'dir lugs kyi don yin no //
translated: The term mode here has the sense of manner.

original: 'byung ba'i tshul gyis kun 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma gang gi mjug thogs su skye bar 'gyur ba thag nye ba'i gnas skabs kyi rgyu ston par byed de /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i tshul gyis kun 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba ni skad cig ma gang gi mjug thogs su skye bar 'gyur ba thag nye ba'i gnas skabs kyi rgyu ston par byed de /
translated: The cause that is the mode of origination refers to the cause of the proximate state, which is the state that immediately arises after a particular moment.

original: 'di las kun 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las kun 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because suffering originates from that.

original: 'brel ba'i tshul gyis rab tu skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'brel ba'i tshul gyis rab tu skye ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The cause that is the mode of relation refers to the cause of the state that is related to the result.

original: rgyun gyi tshul gyis rgyun mi 'chad par ston par byed de sa bon dang myu gu dang sdong bu la sogs pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rgyun gyi tshul gyis rgyun mi 'chad par ston par byed de sa bon dang myu gu dang sdong bu la sogs pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: It is taught to be uninterrupted in the manner of a continuum, like a seed, sprout, trunk, and so on.

original: mngon par sgrub pa'i don gyis na rkyen zhes bya ba ni rgyu la sogs pa mang po zhig las skye bar ston par byed de dper na 'jim gong dang thal zhar la sogs pa mang po zhig las bum pa 'grub pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mngon par sgrub pa'i don gyis na rkyen zhes bya ba ni rgyu la sogs pa mang po zhig las skye bar ston par byed de dper na 'jim gong dang thal zhar la sogs pa mang po zhig las bum pa 'grub pa de dang 'dra'o //

analyzed: gnyis pa yang rnam pa lnga yin no //
translated: The second is also fivefold.

original: gsum pa ni rnam pa bzhi yin la /
analyzed: gsum pa ni rnam pa bzhi yin la /
translated: The third is fourfold.

original: bzhi pa yang rnam pa bzhi yin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa yang rnam pa bzhi yin no //
translated: The fourth is also fourfold.

original: ji ltar zhe na dge slong dag nga'o snyam pa yod cing bdag tu lta ba yod na nga 'di lta bu'o snyam pa 'byung ste zhes bya ba ni nga ni 'di 'dra ba'o snyam pa 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na dge slong dag nga'o snyam pa yod cing bdag tu lta ba yod na nga 'di lta bu'o snyam pa 'byung ste zhes bya ba ni nga ni 'di 'dra ba'o snyam pa 'byung ba ste /
translated: How? ‚ÄúMonks, when there is the thought ‚ÄòI am‚Äô and the view of self exists, the thought ‚ÄòI am like this‚Äô arises.‚Äù The thought ‚ÄúI am like this‚Äù arises.

original: de dang ldan pas sred pa skyed par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dang ldan pas sred pa skyed par byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one who possesses it generates craving.

original: nga ni 'di 'dra'o snyam pa zhes bya ba ni sngon ji lta ba kho na yin gyi gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nga ni 'di 'dra'o snyam pa zhes bya ba ni sngon ji lta ba kho na yin gyi gzhan du ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The thought ‚ÄúI am like this‚Äù is just as it was before, not otherwise.

original: nga de lta ma yin no snyam pa zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang stobs dang spobs pa la sogs pa rnam pa gzhan du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga de lta ma yin no snyam pa zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang stobs dang spobs pa la sogs pa rnam pa gzhan du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The thought ‚ÄúI am not like this‚Äù is because one sees another aspect, such as complexion, strength, eloquence, and so on.

original: nga bzang ngo snyam pa dang / bzlog pa nga ngan no snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nga bzang ngo snyam pa dang / bzlog pa nga ngan no snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The thought ‚ÄúI am good‚Äù and the thought ‚ÄúI am bad‚Äù arise in the opposite way.

original: bdag la 'dun pa rnam pa lnga po 'di ni khyad par med pa dang po yin no //
analyzed: bdag la 'dun pa rnam pa lnga po 'di ni khyad par med pa dang po yin no //
translated: These five kinds of desire for self are the first type of absence of distinction.

original: de la 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rtag pa'i ngo bor ro //
analyzed: de la 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rtag pa'i ngo bor ro //
translated: The thought ‚ÄúI will exist‚Äù is the thought of existence in the form of permanence.

original: 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro snyam pa zhes bya ba ni chad pa'i ngo bor ro //
analyzed: 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro snyam pa zhes bya ba ni chad pa'i ngo bor ro //
translated: The thought ‚ÄúI will not exist‚Äù is the thought of existence in the form of annihilation.

original: 'di lta bur 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa zhes bya ba ni rgyas par bshad pa snga ma dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: 'di lta bur 'byung bar 'gyur ro snyam pa zhes bya ba ni rgyas par bshad pa snga ma dang 'dra ste /
translated: The thought ‚ÄúI will become thus‚Äù is the thought of existence in the form of a particular mode of existence, as explained previously.

original: yang srid pa la 'dun pa rnam pa lnga po 'di khyad par med par gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: yang srid pa la 'dun pa rnam pa lnga po 'di khyad par med par gnyis pa yin no //
translated: These five kinds of desire for existence are the second type of absence of distinction.

original: de la gyur cig snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing de la 'di lta bur gyur cig snyam pa dang / de 'dra bar gyur cig snyam pa dang / de lta ma yin par gyur cig snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang srid pa las 'dun pa rnam pa bzhi po 'di khyad par med pa gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gyur cig snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing de la 'di lta bur gyur cig snyam pa dang / de 'dra bar gyur cig snyam pa dang / de lta ma yin par gyur cig snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba yang srid pa las 'dun pa rnam pa bzhi po 'di khyad par med pa gsum pa yin no //
translated: I may not become such and such.üîΩThe fifth is the four types of aspiration for the fetter of rebirth:üîΩHow good it would be if I were to become such and such,üîΩif I were to become like this,

original: gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa dang / 'di lta bur gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa dang / de 'dra bar gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa dang / de lta ma yin par gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid mtshams sbyor ba 'ching ba la 'dun ba rnam pa bzhi po 'di ni bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa dang / 'di lta bur gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa dang / de 'dra bar gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa dang / de lta ma yin par gyur kyang ci ma rung snyam pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid mtshams sbyor ba 'ching ba la 'dun ba rnam pa bzhi po 'di ni bzhi pa yin no //
translated: if I were to become like that,üîΩif I were to become otherwise.

original: de la dang po ni sdug bsngal gyi dang po'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rtsa ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par snga ma bzhin du sbyar @254b bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni sdug bsngal gyi dang po'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rtsa ba'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par snga ma bzhin du sbyar @254b bar bya'o //
translated: The first is the root cause because it is the initial cause of suffering.

original: so sor nges pa'i phyir sgrub ba ste zhes bya ba ni nges par sgrub cing sgrub par byed pa ni sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i phyir sgrub ba ste zhes bya ba ni nges par sgrub cing sgrub par byed pa ni sgrub pa'o //
translated: The establishment of the aspects is for the sake of definite discernment.

original: yang ji ltar so sor nges pa yin zhe na /üîΩde nyid kyis der 'gro ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang ji ltar so sor nges pa yin zhe na / de nyid kyis der 'gro ba'i phyir te /
translated: How are they definitely discerned?üîΩBecause they go to that, i.e., they go to the aspects of impermanence, etc.

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba lta bu yin no //üîΩrtag pa dang bde ba dang bdag gi dang bdag tu lta ba spyad pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni 'di dag la rtag pa dang bde ba dang bdag gi dang bdag go zhes bya bar lta ba spyad pa yin pas na gang zag 'di dag ni rtag
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba lta bu yin no // rtag pa dang bde ba dang bdag gi dang bdag tu lta ba spyad pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni 'di dag la rtag pa dang bde ba dang bdag gi dang bdag go zhes bya bar lta ba spyad pa yin pas na gang zag 'di dag ni rtag
translated: As it is said,üîΩThose who practice the views of permanence, happiness, mine, and self.üîΩThose who practice the views of permanence, happiness, mine, and self are persons who practice the views of permanence, happiness, mine, and self.

original: pa dang bde ba dang bdag gi dang bdag tu lta ba spyad pa yin te de dag gi gnyen por go rims bzhin du mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: pa dang bde ba dang bdag gi dang bdag tu lta ba spyad pa yin te de dag gi gnyen por go rims bzhin du mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa yin no //
translated: The aspects of impermanence, etc. are their antidotes in that order.

original: rgyu med do zhes rgyu med par lta ba spyad pa rnams kyi gnyen por rgyu'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu med do zhes rgyu med par lta ba spyad pa rnams kyi gnyen por rgyu'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of cause is the antidote for those who practice the view of causelessness.

original: rgyu dbang phyug gam /
analyzed: rgyu dbang phyug gam /
translated: The aspect of cause is the antidote to the view that the cause of the world is a single entity, such as God,

original: gtso bo 'am /
analyzed: gtso bo 'am /
translated: primordial matter, or time.üîΩThe aspect of origination is the antidote to the view that entities are transformed, since it is said:

original: dus zhes bya ba gcig pu yin no zhes rgyu gcig pur lta ba spyad pa rnams kyi gnyen por rgyu ni kun 'byung ba yin gyi gcig pu ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i rnam pa'o //üîΩdngos po ni 'gyur ba yin no zhes 'gyur bar lta ba spyad pa rnams kyi gnyen por dang po 'byung ba 'di yin gyi snga nas gnas pa las 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes rab tu skye ba'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: dus zhes bya ba gcig pu yin no zhes rgyu gcig pur lta ba spyad pa rnams kyi gnyen por rgyu ni kun 'byung ba yin gyi gcig pu ma yin no zhes 'byung ba'i rnam pa'o // dngos po ni 'gyur ba yin no zhes 'gyur bar lta ba spyad pa rnams kyi gnyen por dang po 'byung ba 'di yin gyi snga nas gnas pa las 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes rab tu skye ba'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The cause is origination, not a single entity.

original: 'jig rten 'di ni blo sngar btang ste byas pa yin no zhes blo sngar btang bar lta ba rnams kyi gnyen por rkyen gyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di ni blo sngar btang ste byas pa yin no zhes blo sngar btang bar lta ba rnams kyi gnyen por rkyen gyi rnam pa ste /
translated: The aspect of condition is the antidote to the view that the world is created by an intellect that precedes it, since it is said:

original: 'gro ba 'di ni dbang phyug gis byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'di ni dbang phyug gis byas pa ma yin no //
translated: This world is not created by God.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: rkyen ces bya ba'i sgras ni zlos pa'i don yin pas de dang de la brten nas 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rkyen ces bya ba'i sgras ni zlos pa'i don yin pas de dang de la brten nas 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The term condition indicates repetition, since it is said: This arises in dependence on that and that.

original: de lta bas na 'gro ba ni rkyen du mas bskyed pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'gro ba ni rkyen du mas bskyed pa yin no zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus it is taught that going is generated by many conditions.

original: 'di ltar rig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mdo sde ba'i gzhung lugs yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rig par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mdo sde ba'i gzhung lugs yin no //
translated: It is thus that it is known. This is the Sautrantika system.üîΩThe aspect is the particular way of apprehending the object.

original: rnam pa ni dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i bye brag yin no zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshul ston par byed de /
analyzed: rnam pa ni dmigs pa 'dzin pa'i bye brag yin no zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i tshul ston par byed de /
translated: This shows the mode of ascertainment.

original: de lta yin na shes rab kyang rnam pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: de lta yin na shes rab kyang rnam pa dang bcas par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: If that were so, then it would be established that wisdom also has an aspect.

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i bye brag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i bye brag ces bya ba la /
translated: The distinction of virtue and so on.

original: stsogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dang / sa dang rten bsdu'o //
analyzed: stsogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa dang / sa dang rten bsdu'o //
translated: The term and so on refers to nonvirtue, neutral states, the levels and the basis.

original: tshigs su bcad pa'i dang po na yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di'i dang po yin gyi bstan bcos kyi ni ma yin no zhes ston te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa'i dang po na yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'di'i dang po yin gyi bstan bcos kyi ni ma yin no zhes ston te /
translated: Because it is the first in this verse. This is the first in this text, but not the first in the treatise.

original: bstan bcos las ni chos shes pa dang por 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos las ni chos shes pa dang por 'byung ngo //
translated: In the treatise, Dharma knowledge is the first.

original: drug na chos @255a * //
analyzed: drug na chos @255a * //
translated: In the six, Dharma knowledge.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it focuses on the suffering, etc. of the desire realm.

original: gzugs med pa gsum na yod do zhes bya ni rjes su shes pa bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa gsum na yod do zhes bya ni rjes su shes pa bsgom pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa kho na'o //
translated: The three formless states exist in the formless realm.

original: de bzhin drug ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal shes pa la sogs pa rjes su shes pa'i ngo bo nyid srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin drug ces bya ba ni sdug bsngal shes pa la sogs pa rjes su shes pa'i ngo bo nyid srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The six are similar to those, because the nature of subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc. is possible.üîΩOne does not manifest the knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc. in the form and formless realms.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu ni mngon sum du mi byed do zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa rnams 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i mi dmigs pa'i phyir re zhig chos shes pa gzugs med pa'i khams su mngon sum du miüîΩbyed par ni rigs na /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu ni mngon sum du mi byed do zhes bya ba ni gzugs med pa rnams 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i mi dmigs pa'i phyir re zhig chos shes pa gzugs med pa'i khams su mngon sum du mi byed par ni rigs na /
translated: One does not manifest the knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc. in the formless realm, because formless states do not focus on the desire realm.üîΩBut it is reasonable that one does not manifest the knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc. in the formless realm.

original: gzugs kyi khams su go ci'i phyir mngon sum du mi byed ce na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su go ci'i phyir mngon sum du mi byed ce na /
translated: Why does one not manifest it in the form realm?

original: kha cig na re chos shes pa ni lhur 'dod pa'i khams rnam par sun 'byin pa yin na /
analyzed: kha cig na re chos shes pa ni lhur 'dod pa'i khams rnam par sun 'byin pa yin na /
translated: Some say: The knowledge of the truth of suffering, etc. is the antidote that thoroughly rejects the desire realm.

original: gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa la ni chos shes pa 'dod pa'i khams rnam par su na 'byin pa mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams su skyes pa la ni chos shes pa 'dod pa'i khams rnam par su na 'byin pa mi 'byung ste /
translated: But one born in the form realm does not manifest the Dharma cognition that eliminates the objects to be eliminated by the path of seeing in the desire realm.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang sa 'phos pas de yongs su btang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang sa 'phos pas de yongs su btang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one who is free from attachment to the desire realm relinquishes it through changing level.

original: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa ni de'i 'dod chags dang bral yang 'dod pa'i khams kyi phung po'i lhag ma lus pa'i phyir de mngon sum du byed do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa ni de'i 'dod chags dang bral yang 'dod pa'i khams kyi phung po'i lhag ma lus pa'i phyir de mngon sum du byed do //
translated: One born in the desire realm manifests that Dharma cognition even though one is free from attachment to the desire realm because the desire realm‚Äôs aggregates remain.

original: de'i phyir chos shes pa gzugs kyi khams su mngon sum du mi byed do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos shes pa gzugs kyi khams su mngon sum du mi byed do zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore it is said that Dharma cognition is not manifested in the form realm.

original: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re chos shes pa 'dod pa'i khams kho nar mngon sum du byed kyi de la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldang ba'i sems rnams 'dod pa'i khams kho na na yod pa'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu ma yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon 'dus bzang na re chos shes pa 'dod pa'i khams kho nar mngon sum du byed kyi de la snyoms par 'jug pa dang ldang ba'i sems rnams 'dod pa'i khams kho na na yod pa'i phyir gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams dag tu ma yin no //
translated: Master Sa·πÖghabhadra says: Dharma cognition is manifested only in the desire realm because the minds of entering and rising from meditative attainment exist only in the desire realm and not in the form and formless realms.

original: yang na rjes su 'brang ba'i rten med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na rjes su 'brang ba'i rten med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Or it is because there is no basis for its subsequent arising.

original: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kun nas slong bar byed pa'i nyon mongs pa'i 'thob pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir chos shes pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i tshul khrims kyi rten 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'byung ba dag kho na yin na /
analyzed: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kun nas slong bar byed pa'i nyon mongs pa'i 'thob pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir chos shes pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i tshul khrims kyi rten 'dod pa na spyod pa'i 'byung ba dag kho na yin na /
translated: The basis of Dharma knowledge is the desire realm level alone, because the body of Dharma knowledge is the four great elements that are the support of ethics that is concomitant with Dharma knowledge, since it is the antidote to the obtainment that motivates unethical conduct.

original: de dag kyang de na med pas chos shes pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi rten can kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang de na med pas chos shes pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi rten can kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Since those do not exist in the formless realm, Dharma knowledge has the desire realm as its basis alone.

original: 'gog par shes pa ni gcig ste /
analyzed: 'gog par shes pa ni gcig ste /
translated: Knowledge of cessation is one.üîΩThe application of mindfulness of phenomena is explained in the Compendium of Abhidharma:

original: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa las chos ni lus dang tshor ba dang sems dag las gzhan pa yin bshad pas so //
analyzed: chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no zhes bya ba ni chos dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bstan pa las chos ni lus dang tshor ba dang sems dag las gzhan pa yin bshad pas so //
translated: The phenomena that are other than the body, feeling, and mind are explained to be the application of mindfulness of phenomena.

original: @255b gzhan pa'i shes pa rnams ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi char yin no zhes bya ba ni chos dang rjes dang kun rdzob dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / lam dang / zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa rnams la ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid yod de /
analyzed: @255b gzhan pa'i shes pa rnams ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi char yin no zhes bya ba ni chos dang rjes dang kun rdzob dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / lam dang / zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa rnams la ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid yod de /
translated: The four foundations of mindfulness are included in the nature of the knowledge of suffering, the knowledge of origin, the knowledge of the path, the knowledge of elimination, and the knowledge of nonarising.

original: sdug bsngal shes pa yang res 'ga' ni lus la dmigs la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa yang res 'ga' ni lus la dmigs la /
translated: The knowledge of suffering sometimes focuses on the body,

original: res 'ga' ni chos kyi bar la dmigs so //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni chos kyi bar la dmigs so //
translated: sometimes on the other three foundations of mindfulness up to phenomena.

original: kun 'byung shes pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung shes pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The knowledge of origin is also like that.

original: lam shes pa yang gal te zag pa med pa'i sdom pa la dmigs na de lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: lam shes pa yang gal te zag pa med pa'i sdom pa la dmigs na de lus dran pa nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The knowledge of the path, if it focuses on the uncontaminated vows, is the foundation of mindfulness of body.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: rjes su shes pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni chos shes pa ma gtogs so //
analyzed: rjes su shes pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni chos shes pa ma gtogs so //
translated: Except for subsequent knowledge means except for the knowledge of the truth of the path.

original: gal te zag pa med pa'i shes pa la dmigs par byed na /
analyzed: gal te zag pa med pa'i shes pa la dmigs par byed na /
translated: If it focuses on uncontaminated knowledge,

original: chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa kho na la dmigs par byed la /
analyzed: chos shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa kho na la dmigs par byed la /
translated: It focuses on the state of knowing Dharma alone.

original: de bzhin du rjes su shes pa yang rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa kho na la dmigs par byed do zhes bya bar nges te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su shes pa yang rjes su shes pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa kho na la dmigs par byed do zhes bya bar nges te /
translated: Similarly, it is ascertained that subsequent knowledge focuses on the state of subsequent knowledge alone.

original: de la chos shes pa lam shes par gyur pa'i dmigs pas ni chos shes pa gzhan dang sdug bsngal shes pa la sogs pa mi skye ba shes pa la thug pa'i bar yin par srid la /
analyzed: de la chos shes pa lam shes par gyur pa'i dmigs pas ni chos shes pa gzhan dang sdug bsngal shes pa la sogs pa mi skye ba shes pa la thug pa'i bar yin par srid la /
translated: The focal object of the knowledge of the truth of path that is the state of knowing Dharma is the other knowledge of Dharma and the knowledge of suffering and so on up to the knowledge of nonarising.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang kun 'byung ba shes par gyur pa'i dmigs pa ni kun rdzob shes pa yin par srid la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang kun 'byung ba shes par gyur pa'i dmigs pa ni kun rdzob shes pa yin par srid la /
translated: The focal object of the knowledge of the truths of suffering and origin that are the state of knowing Dharma is conventional knowledge.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes par gyur pa'i dmigs pa ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa yin par srid pas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes par gyur pa'i dmigs pa ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa yin par srid pas /
translated: The focal object of the knowledge of others' minds that is the state of knowing Dharma is the knowledge of others' minds.

original: de'i dmigs pa shes pa dgu yin no //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa shes pa dgu yin no //
translated: Therefore the focal object of the state of knowing Dharma is nine knowledges.

original: de bzhin du rjes su shes pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su shes pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same is true of subsequent knowledge.

original: lam shes pa'i dmigs pa la yang dgu kho na yin te /
analyzed: lam shes pa'i dmigs pa la yang dgu kho na yin te /
translated: The focal object of the knowledge of the truth of path is nine knowledges alone.

original: kun rdzob shes pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni lam shes pa ni zag pa med pa'i lam la dmigs par nges pa'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa la mi dmigs so /
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni lam shes pa ni zag pa med pa'i lam la dmigs par nges pa'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa la mi dmigs so /
translated: Except for conventional knowledge. Knowledge of the path is definitely focused on the uncontaminated path, so it does not focus on conventional knowledge.

original: gnyis te kun rdzob dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i khongs su gtogs pa dag go //
analyzed: gnyis te kun rdzob dang gzhan gyi sems shes pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba'i bden pa'i khongs su gtogs pa dag go //
translated: Two: conventional knowledge and knowledge of others' minds.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa zag pa med pa gang yin pa de'i dmigs pa ni shes pa dgu yin la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa zag pa med pa gang yin pa de'i dmigs pa ni shes pa dgu yin la /
translated: Any uncontaminated knowledge of others' minds focuses on nine knowledges.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de'i dmigs pa ni kun rdzob shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa yin par srid do //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de'i dmigs pa ni kun rdzob shes pa dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa yin par srid do //
translated: Any contaminated knowledge of others' minds may focus on conventional knowledge and knowledge of others' minds.

original: zad pa shes @256a * //
analyzed: zad pa shes @256a * //
translated: Knowledge of elimination and nonarisingüîΩfocus on all ten knowledges.

original: ba dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba shes pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas de dag gi dmigs pa ni shes pa bcu char yang yin no //
analyzed: ba dang mi skye ba shes pa dag ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba shes pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas de dag gi dmigs pa ni shes pa bcu char yang yin no //
translated: Knowledge of elimination and knowledge of nonarising are by nature knowledge of suffering and origin and so on. Therefore they focus on all ten knowledges.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba la /üîΩmtshungs par ldan pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba la / mtshungs par ldan pa ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams so //

original: ldan pa ma yin pa ni thob pa la sogs pa'o //üîΩdge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba la dge ba ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin te /
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa ni thob pa la sogs pa'o // dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i bye brag gis zhes bya ba la dge ba ni so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yin te /

original: mchog tu bde ba'i phyir ro //üîΩlung du ma bstan pa ni nam mkha' dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pas 'gog pa dag go //üîΩ'dod pa na spyod pa dang / zag pa med pa dang bzhi zhes bya ba ni mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i bye brag gis so //

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa dang drug ces bya ba ni so sor mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i bye brag gis te /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang zag pa med pa dang drug ces bya ba ni so sor mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i bye brag gis te /

original: shes pa gcig gis chos thams cad shes par 'gyur ba yod dam zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa gcig gis chos thams cad shes par 'gyur ba yod dam zhe na /
translated: Is there a single consciousness that knows all phenomena?

original: med do zhes bya ba ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: med do zhes bya ba ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do we know that?

original: mdo las te /
analyzed: mdo las te /
translated: From a sutra.

original: kye goo ta ma bdag cag 'dun khang 'dir 'dus te mchis pa rnams 'di lta bu'i bka' mchid thor bu gleng langs te /
analyzed: kye goo ta ma bdag cag 'dun khang 'dir 'dus te mchis pa rnams 'di lta bu'i bka' mchid thor bu gleng langs te /
translated: Gautama, we have gathered in this assembly hall and have been discussing this topic:üîΩ‚ÄúIt is said that the ascetic Gautama has said, ‚ÄòThere is no ascetic or brahmin who knows everything and sees everything.‚Äô

original: dge sbyong goo ta ma 'di skad du dge sbyong ngam bram ze yang rung gang thams cad shes shing thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ba de ni 'ga' yang med do zhes @256b gsungs zhes grag go zhes mchi na kye goo ta ma 'di mad  dam /
analyzed: dge sbyong goo ta ma 'di skad du dge sbyong ngam bram ze yang rung gang thams cad shes shing thams cad mthong bar 'gyur ba de ni 'ga' yang med do zhes @256b gsungs zhes grag go zhes mchi na kye goo ta ma 'di mad  dam /
translated: Gautama, is this true?‚Äù

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: Gautama replied, ‚Äú

original: kye ngas da skad du smras bar ni dran mod kyi /
analyzed: kye ngas da skad du smras bar ni dran mod kyi /
translated: I do remember saying that,

original: 'on kyang dge sbyong ngam bram ze yang rung gang cig car thams cad shes pa'am mthong ba de ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'on kyang dge sbyong ngam bram ze yang rung gang cig car thams cad shes pa'am mthong ba de ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba yin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: but I said, ‚ÄòThere is no ascetic or brahmin who knows or sees everything simultaneously.‚Äô‚Äù

original: yul dad yul can tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni yul dang yul can gang yin ba de nyid de'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: yul dad yul can tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni yul dang yul can gang yin ba de nyid de'i yul ma yin te /
translated: The object is not the subject,üîΩjust as the edge of a sword does not cut itself.

original: ral gri'i so de nyid de nyid kyis mi gcod pa de'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa des rang gi ngo bo mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: ral gri'i so de nyid de nyid kyis mi gcod pa de'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa des rang gi ngo bo mi 'dzin to //
translated: Therefore, conventional knowledge does not grasp its own nature.

original: dmigs pa gcig pa'i phyir des lhan cig 'byung ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa gcig pa'i phyir des lhan cig 'byung ba'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyang mi 'dzin te /
translated: It also does not grasp the mind and mental factors that arise simultaneously with it, because they have the same object.

original: kun rdzob shes pa 'di'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyi yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa 'di'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid mtshungs par ldan pa rnams kyi yin no //
translated: Whatever is the object of this conventional knowledge is also the object of the concomitant [mind and mental factors].

original: gal te mtshungs par ldan pa de dag 'dzin par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te mtshungs par ldan pa de dag 'dzin par 'gyur na ni /
translated: If those concomitants were to grasp it,

original: kun rdzob shes pa dang dmigs pa gcig pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo la dmigs par 'gyur ba zhig na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa dang dmigs pa gcig pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo la dmigs par 'gyur ba zhig na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: because conventional knowledge and its object are the same, it would be an object of its own nature. But that is illogical.

original: de lta bas na des de dag mi 'dzin to //
analyzed: de lta bas na des de dag mi 'dzin to //
translated: Therefore, it does not grasp them.

original: ha cang nye ba'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba ldan pa ma yin pa de dag kyang mi 'dzin te /
analyzed: ha cang nye ba'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba ldan pa ma yin pa de dag kyang mi 'dzin te /
translated: They do not apprehend coemergent nonpossession because it is too close.

original: mig gis mig sman dang mig sman gyi thur ma mi mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: mig gis mig sman dang mig sman gyi thur ma mi mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: Just as the eye does not see the eye ointment or the eye ointment stick.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob shes pa'o //üîΩde ni sa rnam par chad pa la dmigs ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar kun rdzob shes pa gzugs na spyod pa bsgoms pa las byung ba ni 'dod pa'i khams sam /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob shes pa'o // de ni sa rnam par chad pa la dmigs ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar kun rdzob shes pa gzugs na spyod pa bsgoms pa las byung ba ni 'dod pa'i khams sam /
translated: That also means conventional knowledge.üîΩBecause it focuses on a domain that is divided into levels.

original: bsam gtan dang po nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar sa rnam par chad pa kho na la dmigs so //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar sa rnam par chad pa kho na la dmigs so //
translated: Thus, conventional knowledge that is cultivated in the form realm focuses on the domain that is divided into levels of the desire realm or the first absorption up to the summit of existence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams go rims bzhin dus 'og ma dang gong ma la dmigs pa'i phyir te go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: bar chad med pa dang rnam par grol ba'i lam rnams go rims bzhin dus 'og ma dang gong ma la dmigs pa'i phyir te go rims bzhin du /
translated: Because the uninterrupted and liberated paths focus on lower and higher levels, respectively.

original: zhi stsogs rags stsogs rnam pa ni //
analyzed: zhi stsogs rags stsogs rnam pa ni //
translated: The aspects of peace and so on and coarseness and so on

original: gong dang 'og ma'i spyod yul can //üîΩzhes 'byung bas so //
analyzed: gong dang 'og ma'i spyod yul can //üîΩzhes 'byung bas so //
translated: are the domain of higher and lower levels.

original: gal te des sa thams cad la dmigs par gyur na ni thams cad las cig car 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te des sa thams cad la dmigs par gyur na ni thams cad las cig car 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it focused on all levels, then one would be simultaneously freed from all of them.

original: sbyor ba dang khyad par gyi lam dag gi dmigs pa yang ci rigs par sa 'ga' zhig kho na yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang khyad par gyi lam dag gi dmigs pa yang ci rigs par sa 'ga' zhig kho na yin no //
translated: The focal object of the path of preparation and the special path is any one level, as is appropriate.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i sbyor ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa gang gi dmigs pa 'dod pa'i khams yin pa @257a * //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i sbyor ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa gang gi dmigs pa 'dod pa'i khams yin pa @257a * //
translated: The focal object of any path of preparation that is subsumed by the factors conducive to penetrative insight is the desire realm.

original: de'i khams gzhan dag ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i khams gzhan dag ma yin te /
translated: It is not the other realms.üîΩThe focal object of any path of preparation that is subsumed by the factors conducive to superior states is the form realm.

original: gang gi dmigs pa gzhan dag yin ba de'i 'dod pa'i khams ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi dmigs pa gzhan dag yin ba de'i 'dod pa'i khams ma yin no //
translated: It is not the desire realm.üîΩThe focal object of any path of preparation that is subsumed by the path of elimination is the formless realm.üîΩIt is not the desire realm or the form realm.

original: mi sdug pa dang / tshad med pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched la sogs pa dang / rnam par sun 'byin pa dang / khyad par can gyi lam gyis bsdus pa'i dmigs pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: mi sdug pa dang / tshad med pa dang / zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched la sogs pa dang / rnam par sun 'byin pa dang / khyad par can gyi lam gyis bsdus pa'i dmigs pa ni 'dod pa'i khams kho na yin gyi /
translated: The focal object of any path of preparation that is subsumed by the special path is the desire realm alone.

original: khams gzhan dag ma yin no //
analyzed: khams gzhan dag ma yin no //
translated: It is not the other realms.

original: zag med skad cig dang po la //
analyzed: zag med skad cig dang po la //
translated: The first moment of uncontaminated states

original: chags can shes pa gcig dang ldan //
analyzed: chags can shes pa gcig dang ldan //
translated: Those with attachment have one.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar bzod pa yang shes pa ma yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar bzod pa yang shes pa ma yin la /
translated: Thus, one who possesses patience does not possess knowledge,

original: zag pa med pa'i shes pa gzhan dang yang mi ldan pas so //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i shes pa gzhan dang yang mi ldan pas so //
translated: and one who possesses uncontaminated knowledge does not possess patience.

original: chags can zhes smos pa ni 'di ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang yang ldan par 'gyur ro //üîΩgnyis pa la gsum zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa de nyid chos shes pa zhes kyang bya la /
analyzed: chags can zhes smos pa ni 'di ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang yang ldan par 'gyur ro // gnyis pa la gsum zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa de nyid chos shes pa zhes kyang bya la /
translated: The term ‚Äúthose with attachment‚Äù is stated because those free from attachment possess knowledge of others‚Äô minds.üîΩThose on the second have three.

original: sdug bsngal shes pa zhes kyang bya bas ming tha dad pa'i sgo nas gnyis su nye bar gdags na chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa ste gsum dang ldan no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal shes pa zhes kyang bya bas ming tha dad pa'i sgo nas gnyis su nye bar gdags na chos shes pa dang / sdug bsngal shes pa dang / kun rdzob shes pa ste gsum dang ldan no //
translated: Those on the second absorption have three: Dharma knowledge, subsequent knowledge, and conventional knowledge.üîΩThose on the fourth have four.

original: bzhi la zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i skad cig dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam la chos shes pa'i skad cig ma dag la ste /
analyzed: bzhi la zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i skad cig dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam la chos shes pa'i skad cig ma dag la ste /
translated: Those on the fourth absorption have four: the moment of subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering, and the moments of Dharma knowledge of the truths of origin, cessation, and path.

original: bzod pa dag la ni snga ma kho na bzhin du ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzod pa dag la ni snga ma kho na bzhin du ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Patience is like the former.

original: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i skad cig ma la ni rjes su shes pa kho na 'phel gyi /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la rjes su shes pa'i skad cig ma la ni rjes su shes pa kho na 'phel gyi /
translated: In the moment of subsequent knowledge of the truth of suffering, only subsequent knowledge increases,

original: chos shes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos shes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but not Dharma knowledge,

original: de dag dang ni snga nas ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag dang ni snga nas ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one already possesses that.

original: kun 'byung ba la chos shes pa'i skad cig ma la ni kun 'byung ba shes pa kho na 'phel gyi /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba la chos shes pa'i skad cig ma la ni kun 'byung ba shes pa kho na 'phel gyi /
translated: In the moment of Dharma knowledge of the truth of origin, only knowledge of origin increases,

original: chos dang rjes su shes pa dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos dang rjes su shes pa dag ni ma yin te /
translated: but not Dharma or subsequent knowledge,

original: de dag dang ni snga nas ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag dang ni snga nas ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one already possesses those.

original: de bzhin du 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa'i skad cig ma dag la ni 'gog pa dang lam shes pa dag kho na 'phel lo zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gog pa dang lam la chos shes pa'i skad cig ma dag la ni 'gog pa dang lam shes pa dag kho na 'phel lo zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, it should be stated that in the moments of Dharma knowledge of the truths of cessation and path, only knowledge of cessation and path increase.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig yin na ni thams cad du gzhan gyi sems shes pa lhag par ldan zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa nas lam la chos shes pa'i skad cig ma'i bar la gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang ji skad
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhig yin na ni thams cad du gzhan gyi sems shes pa lhag par ldan zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa nas lam la chos shes pa'i skad cig ma'i bar la gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang ji skad
