original: yang na de dag kyang 'dra ba 'thob pa'i phyir dri bar bya dgos te /
analyzed: yang na de dag kyang 'dra ba 'thob pa'i phyir dri bar bya dgos te /
translated: Or it should be asked whether one obtains similar perseverance because

original: sdug bsngal la bzod pa skyes na kun 'byung ba la sogs pa'i bzod pa'i rnam pa 'thob pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la bzod pa skyes na kun 'byung ba la sogs pa'i bzod pa'i rnam pa 'thob pa ni ma yin no //
translated: one does not obtain the aspects of perseverance for the truth of origin and so on when perseverance for the truth of suffering arises.

original: dper brjod pa tsam gyi don du zad pas shes pa yongs su dris kyi bzod pa ni yongs su ma dris so //
analyzed: dper brjod pa tsam gyi don du zad pas shes pa yongs su dris kyi bzod pa ni yongs su ma dris so //
translated: The meaning of the example is exhausted, so the knowledge is completely questioned, but the acceptance is not completely questioned.

original: rigs rnams ma thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu rnams ma thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rigs rnams ma thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu rnams ma thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because the lineages have not been obtained means that homogeneous causes have not been obtained.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes na de'i rigs dang de'i rnam pa bzhi'i rigs rnams 'thob par @258a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa skyes na de'i rigs dang de'i rnam pa bzhi'i rigs rnams 'thob par @258a * //
translated: When perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering arises, the lineage of that and the four lineages of its aspects are obtained.

original: 'gyur gyi / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa'i ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur gyi / sdug bsngal la chos shes pa la sogs pa'i ma yin no //
translated: But the lineage of Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering and so on is not obtained.

original: yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag las rnam pa re re zhig mngon sum du gyur na /
analyzed: yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag las rnam pa re re zhig mngon sum du gyur na /
translated: Moreover, when any one of the aspects such as impermanence and so on becomes manifest,

original: ci'i phyir rnam pa lhag ma rnams kyi rigs 'thob /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam pa lhag ma rnams kyi rigs 'thob /
translated: why are the lineages of the remaining aspects obtained?

original: gang gis na de dag kyang 'thob par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis na de dag kyang 'thob par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: By what means are they also obtained?

original: dmigs pa mtshungs pa nyid kyis 'dra ba'i phyir thams cad kyi rigs 'thob bo //
analyzed: dmigs pa mtshungs pa nyid kyis 'dra ba'i phyir thams cad kyi rigs 'thob bo //
translated: All lineages are obtained because they are similar through having the same focal object.

original: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la chos shes pa skyes pa nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du sdug bsngal la chos shes pa skyes pa nas /
translated: So too, when Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering arises,

original: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa skyes pa'i bar la de dag dang de dag gi rnam pa'i rigs rnams 'thob par 'gyur bas de dag kho na 'thob bar 'gyur gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa'i bzod pa skyes pa'i bar la de dag dang de dag gi rnam pa'i rigs rnams 'thob par 'gyur bas de dag kho na 'thob bar 'gyur gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: up to when subsequent perseverance for subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path arises, one obtains those and the types of their aspects, but one does not obtain any others.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la ni shes pa 'dra ba dang / mi 'dra ba dang / de dag gi rnam pa thams cad mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i phyir thams cad kyi rgyu thob par 'gyur bas de las khyad par du 'phags pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa ma 'ongs pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la ni shes pa 'dra ba dang / mi 'dra ba dang / de dag gi rnam pa thams cad mngon sum du 'gyur ba'i phyir thams cad kyi rgyu thob par 'gyur bas de las khyad par du 'phags pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa ma 'ongs pa 'thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: On the path of meditation, one obtains all causes because one directly perceives similar and dissimilar knowledge and all their aspects. Therefore one obtains future aspects of knowledge that are superior to those.

original: rjes gsum la ni kun rdzob kyang //
analyzed: rjes gsum la ni kun rdzob kyang //
translated: On the three subsequent, also conventional.

original: zhes bya ba ni sngon ma thob pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngon ma thob pa'o //
translated: This refers to those not previously obtained.

original: chos shes pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos shes pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: One does not obtain conventional knowledge on the path of seeing.

original: bden ba zad par mngon par ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba spangs pa dang / de'i 'gog pa mngon du byas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bden ba zad par mngon par ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa dang / kun 'byung ba spangs pa dang / de'i 'gog pa mngon du byas pa ma yin no //
translated: At that time, one does not fully understand suffering and abandon origination in the form and formless realms, nor does one manifest their cessation.üîΩBecause one does not fully understand the truth of the path through the mundane path.

original: lam gyi bden pa ni sngon 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis mngon par ma rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba ni sngon 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa mngon par rtogs kyi /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa ni sngon 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis mngon par ma rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba ni sngon 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa mngon par rtogs kyi /
translated: In beginningless samsara, one has fully understood suffering and origination and manifested their cessation through the mundane path.

original: kun rdzob shes pas ni nam yang lam la lam la sogs pa'i rnam par mngon par ma rtogs so //
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pas ni nam yang lam la lam la sogs pa'i rnam par mngon par ma rtogs so //
translated: But one has never fully understood the path as the path, etc., through conventional knowledge.

original: de bas na gsum las bden pa re re mngon par rtogs pa'i rjes la 'thob par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de bas na gsum las bden pa re re mngon par rtogs pa'i rjes la 'thob par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, one obtains the three knowledges after fully understanding each truth,

original: lam la rjes su shes pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not after subsequent knowledge of the truth of the path.

original: lam ni zad par bsgom par mi nus zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du bya bar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / de'i tshe kun 'byung ba yang thams cad spangs pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa dang / lam mthong ba dang /
analyzed: lam ni zad par bsgom par mi nus zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du bya bar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / de'i tshe kun 'byung ba yang thams cad spangs pa ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa dang / lam mthong ba dang /
translated: The path cannot be cultivated as an elimination, that is, it cannot be actualized.

original: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'o //
translated: At that time, the origin is not completely abandoned, that is, it is not abandoned by seeing cessation and the path and by the path of cultivation.

original: sdug bsngal ni khams gsum pa thams cad yongs su shes te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni khams gsum pa thams cad yongs su shes te /
translated: Suffering is completely known in all its aspects,

original: de ni yongs su shes par bya ba yin @258b ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni yongs su shes par bya ba yin @258b ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is to be completely known.

original: de'i phyir kun 'byung ba 'ba' zhig la rgol lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun 'byung ba 'ba' zhig la rgol lo //
translated: Therefore, one only opposes the origin.

original: de'i bden pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i bden pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That which is to be abandoned by seeing its truth means that which is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin.

original: rigs mang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rigs mang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because there are many lineages.

original: rigs ni lus kyi rgyud kyi nus pa'i khyad par yin no //
analyzed: rigs ni lus kyi rgyud kyi nus pa'i khyad par yin no //
translated: Lineage is a special potency in the body continuum.

original: 'di la rigs de dag mang po zhig yod pas lam rigs mang po can yin te /
analyzed: 'di la rigs de dag mang po zhig yod pas lam rigs mang po can yin te /
translated: Since there are many of these lineages here, the path has many lineages.

original: nyan thos kyi rigs dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs dang / de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi rigs so //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi rigs dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi rigs dang / de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi rigs so //
translated: the sravaka lineage, the pratyekabuddha lineage, and the buddha lineage.

original: nyan thos kyi rigs kyang chung ngu dang chen po'i bye brag gis phan tshun tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi rigs kyang chung ngu dang chen po'i bye brag gis phan tshun tha dad pa ste /
translated: The sravaka lineage is also differentiated as lesser and greater.

original: de dag las mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i gnyen po 'ga' zhig kho na bsgom zhing mngon sum du byed par zad kyi lam zad par bsgom par ni mi nus so //
analyzed: de dag las mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i gnyen po 'ga' zhig kho na bsgom zhing mngon sum du byed par zad kyi lam zad par bsgom par ni mi nus so //
translated: From among those, one cultivates and manifests only some antidotes that are the path of meditation that abandon objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing, but one is unable to cultivate the path in its entirety.üîΩBecause it is the retinue of the path of seeing

original: mthong ba'i lam gyi 'khor yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob shes pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyi 'khor yin pas de'i phyir mthong ba'i lam la bden pa gsum gyi rjes kho na la 'thob kyi /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyi 'khor yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob shes pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyi 'khor yin pas de'i phyir mthong ba'i lam la bden pa gsum gyi rjes kho na la 'thob kyi /
translated: because conventional knowledge is the retinue of the path of seeing, therefore it is obtained on the path of seeing alone in the aftermath of the three truths.

original: lam gyi rjes la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: lam gyi rjes la ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not obtained in the aftermath of the truth of the path

original: de ni bsgom pa'i lam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bsgom pa'i lam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is the path of meditation.üîΩIt is not to be obtained

original: bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is not to be obtained.

original: shes par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi 'khor kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: shes par byed pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyi 'khor kho na yin gyi /
translated: It is not a knower of bases.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'khor ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub dgos so ;
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'khor ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni bsgrub dgos so ;
translated: This is to be established: it is only a companion of the path of seeing, it is not a companion of the path of meditation.

original: ; kho bo ni de bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'khor yang yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: ; kho bo ni de bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'khor yang yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: We say that it is also a companion of the path of meditation.üîΩIt is called ‚Äúsuperior‚Äù because it focuses on the truths.

original: ches khyad par du 'phags pa bden pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i gnas skabs las sngon 'jig rten pa yod pa gang yin pa de bas 'jig rten pa 'di ches khyad par du 'phags so snyam du bsams ba yin no //
analyzed: ches khyad par du 'phags pa bden pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i gnas skabs las sngon 'jig rten pa yod pa gang yin pa de bas 'jig rten pa 'di ches khyad par du 'phags so snyam du bsams ba yin no //
translated: It is thought that this mundane knowledge is superior to any mundane knowledge that existed previously during the period of seeing.

original: de mngon sum du 'gyur bar nus pa'i rten rnyed pa gang yin pa de nyid ces bya ba ni kun rdzob shes pa ste /
analyzed: de mngon sum du 'gyur bar nus pa'i rten rnyed pa gang yin pa de nyid ces bya ba ni kun rdzob shes pa ste /
translated: It is called ‚Äúthat very attainment of a basis capable of manifesting it‚Äù because it is conventional knowledge.

original: mngon sum du 'gyur bar nus pa'i rten rnyed pa gang yin pa 'di de rnyed pa yin gyi don gzhan du 'gyur ba ni med do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum du 'gyur bar nus pa'i rten rnyed pa gang yin pa 'di de rnyed pa yin gyi don gzhan du 'gyur ba ni med do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: That attainment of a basis capable of manifesting it is its attainment, but it does not become something else.

original: rigs rnyed na rigs las byung ba yang rnyed pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rigs rnyed na rigs las byung ba yang rnyed pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one obtains the lineage, one also obtains that which arises from the lineage.

original: rigs ni da skyed par nus pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rigs ni da skyed par nus pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The lineage is the cause that is able to generate that which arises from the lineage.

original: de las byung ba na rigs las byung ba ni kun rdzob shes pa yin te /
analyzed: de las byung ba na rigs las byung ba ni kun rdzob shes pa yin te /
translated: That which arises from the lineage is conventional knowledge.

original: 'di skad du de mngon sum du 'gyur bar nus pa'i rten rnyed na rten des bskyed par bya ba de yang rnyed pa yin no zhes bshad par @259a * //
analyzed: 'di skad du de mngon sum du 'gyur bar nus pa'i rten rnyed na rten des bskyed par bya ba de yang rnyed pa yin no zhes bshad par @259a * //
translated: This is what is being said: If one obtains the basis that is able to manifest that knowledge, one also obtains that which is generated by that basis.

original: 'gyur ro // yang ci'i phyir bye brag tu smra ba rnams de ltar mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: 'gyur ro // yang ci'i phyir bye brag tu smra ba rnams de ltar mi 'dod ce na /
translated: Why don't Vaibhasikas assert that?

original: de ni mthong ba'i lam gyis thob par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni mthong ba'i lam gyis thob par bya ba yin no //
translated: It is to be obtained by the path of seeing.

original: ji ltar de bsgom pa'i lam la mngon sum du 'gyur te mthong ba'i lam la ni de skye ba'i go skabs med pas mi skye ba'i chos can yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: ji ltar de bsgom pa'i lam la mngon sum du 'gyur te mthong ba'i lam la ni de skye ba'i go skabs med pas mi skye ba'i chos can yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: How can it manifest on the path of meditation? It is said that it does not arise on the path of seeing because there is no opportunity for it to arise.

original: de bzhin du mthong ba'i lam bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te bsam gtan dang po'i sa ba zhig yin na /
analyzed: de bzhin du mthong ba'i lam bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin no zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te bsam gtan dang po'i sa ba zhig yin na /
translated: So too, the path of seeing is the level of the fourth absorption.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa dang / mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa dang sa gsum pa 'thob po /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sa pa dang / mi lcogs pa med pa'i sa pa dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa dang sa gsum pa 'thob po /
translated: If it is the level of the first absorption, then it obtains three levels: the level of the first absorption, the level of unrestricted access concentration and the level of the desire realm.

original: gal te bsam gtan khyad par can gyis pa zhig yin na bsam gtan khyad par can gyi sa pa dang / sngar bshad pa bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa'i sa pa dang / sa bzhi pa 'thob po /
analyzed: gal te bsam gtan khyad par can gyis pa zhig yin na bsam gtan khyad par can gyi sa pa dang / sngar bshad pa bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa'i sa pa dang / sa bzhi pa 'thob po /
translated: If it is the level of special absorption, then it obtains four levels: the level of special absorption, the level of the first absorption and so on, as previously explained, and the level of unrestricted access concentration.

original: de bzhin du gal te bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa yin na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gal te bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa yin na /
translated: So too, if it is the level of the second absorption,

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa nas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bar sa lnga pa 'thob po //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i sa pa nas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bar sa lnga pa 'thob po //
translated: then it obtains five levels: from the level of the second absorption to the level of the desire realm.

original: gal te bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa zhig yin na /
analyzed: gal te bsam gtan gsum pa'i sa pa zhig yin na /
translated: If it is the level of the third absorption,

original: bsam gtan gsum pa nas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bar sa drug pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa nas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bar sa drug pa 'thob bo //
translated: then it obtains six levels: from the level of the third absorption to the level of the desire realm.

original: gal te bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa zhig yin na bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa nas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bar sa bdun pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: gal te bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa zhig yin na bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa nas 'dod pa na spyod pa'i bar sa bdun pa 'thob bo //
translated: If it is on the fourth absorption level, then it is obtained on seven levels, from the fourth absorption level down to the desire realm level.üîΩSince one is specified, the remaining are established as being the nature of all four foundations of mindfulness.

original: gcig grangs bcad pas lhag ma ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi char yin no zhes bya bar grub bo zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i ni tha ma kho na yin la tha ma kho na yang 'gog pa'i yin no zhes gnyi ga nges par gzung ba'i
analyzed: gcig grangs bcad pas lhag ma ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi char yin no zhes bya bar grub bo zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa'i ni tha ma kho na yin la tha ma kho na yang 'gog pa'i yin no zhes gnyi ga nges par gzung ba'i
translated: This is because both are ascertained: the last is only of cessation, and that which is only the last is of cessation.

original: phyir lhag ma ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya bar grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir lhag ma ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya bar grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore the remaining are established as being the nature of all four foundations of mindfulness.

original: sdug bsngal ni lus la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid pa'i phyir sdug bsngal mngon par rtogs pa na 'thob pa'i kun rdzob shes pa gang yin pa de ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi char yin te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni lus la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid pa'i phyir sdug bsngal mngon par rtogs pa na 'thob pa'i kun rdzob shes pa gang yin pa de ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi char yin te /
translated: Because suffering is the nature of the body and so on, any conventional knowledge obtained when realizing suffering is the nature of all four foundations of mindfulness.

original: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba la yang brjod bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba la yang brjod bar bya'o //
translated: So too, it should be stated in the same way for the origin.

original: bden pa de'i rnam pa can kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal mngon par rtogs pa na /
analyzed: bden pa de'i rnam pa can kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal mngon par rtogs pa na /
translated: It has the aspect of that truth.

original: 'thob pa'i kun rdzob shes pa gang yin pa de ni so sor mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / stang  pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa can @259b yin te /
analyzed: 'thob pa'i kun rdzob shes pa gang yin pa de ni so sor mi rtag pa dang sdug bsngal ba dang / stang  pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa can @259b yin te /
translated: The conventional knowledge that is obtained when the truth of suffering is realized has the aspects of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness.

original: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said for the truths of origin and cessation.

original: 'di'i dmigs pa yang bden pa de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar rnam pa de ni de la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di'i dmigs pa yang bden pa de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar rnam pa de ni de la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Its object is that very truth, because its aspect is that.

original: sbyor ba las byung ba yin zhes bya ba ni des na skye bas 'thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba yin zhes bya ba ni des na skye bas 'thob pa ma yin no //
translated: It is derived from practice, because it is not obtained from birth.

original: phung po bzhi dang / lnga'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa la rjes su 'brang ba'i gzugs med pa'i phung po bzhi'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: phung po bzhi dang / lnga'i rang bzhin yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa la rjes su 'brang ba'i gzugs med pa'i phung po bzhi'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: It has the nature of four or five aggregates, because it has the nature of the four formless aggregates that are associated with the realm of desire.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The aggregates of feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: sa gong ma pa ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin yin te ;
analyzed: sa gong ma pa ni phung po lnga'i rang bzhin yin te ;
translated: The form of the higher realms is the nature of five aggregates.

original: bsam gtan gyi sdom pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzugs kyi phung po yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi sdom pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzugs kyi phung po yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the aggregate of form exists there in the aspect of the meditative discipline of the absorptions.

original: shes pa gnyis da ltar byung ba yin zhes bya ba ni rjes su shes pa dang lam shes pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa gnyis da ltar byung ba yin zhes bya ba ni rjes su shes pa dang lam shes pa ste /
translated: Two knowledges are present: subsequent knowledge and the knowledge of the path.

original: lam la rjes su shes pa ni de gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lam la rjes su shes pa ni de gnyi ga'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Subsequent knowledge of the path is the nature of both of those.

original: ma 'ongs pa drug ces bya ba ni chos shes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa drug ces bya ba ni chos shes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Six future knowledges are obtained: Dharma knowledge and so on.

original: kun rdzob shes pa ni mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa ni mi 'thob ste /
translated: Conventional knowledge is not obtained.

original: sngon rnyed zin pa ni mi 'thob bo zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon rnyed zin pa ni mi 'thob bo zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is explained that what was previously obtained is not obtained.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa yang mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa yang mi 'thob ste /
translated: Knowledge of others' minds is not obtained.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is free from attachment.

original: de'i gong ma chags bcas kyi //
analyzed: de'i gong ma chags bcas kyi //
translated: The higher realms are associated with attachment.

original: bsgom pa'i lam la bdun 'thob bo //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam la bdun 'thob bo //
translated: One obtains seven on the path of cultivation.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gcig spangs pa nas rnam pa brgyad spangs pa'i bar te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gcig spangs pa nas rnam pa brgyad spangs pa'i bar te /
translated: This refers to the stage of the path of cultivation from the stage of the first to the stage of the eighth.

original: ji srid du 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin zhing /
analyzed: ji srid du 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin zhing /
translated: As long as one is not free from attachment,

original: ji srid du rnam pa dgu pa spangs pa yin pa'i bar skabs 'dir sbyor ba dang bar chad pa med pa dang rnam par grol ba dang khyad par can gyi lam thob pa na shes pa bdun 'thob ste /
analyzed: ji srid du rnam pa dgu pa spangs pa yin pa'i bar skabs 'dir sbyor ba dang bar chad pa med pa dang rnam par grol ba dang khyad par can gyi lam thob pa na shes pa bdun 'thob ste /
translated: as long as one has not abandoned the ninth category of defilements to be abandoned by the path of cultivation, one obtains seven knowledges, namely, the knowledge of dharmas, subsequent knowledge, knowledge of the path, knowledge of the four truths, and conventional knowledge, when one obtains the path of preparation, the uninterrupted path, the path of liberation, and the special path.

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ma gtogs pa chos shes pa la sogs pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ma gtogs pa chos shes pa la sogs pa 'thob bo //
translated: The knowledge of the mind of another is excluded.

original: gal te bsgom pa'i lam 'jig rten pa zhi ba la sogs pa dang rags pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can zhig yin ni kun rdzob shes pad ltar 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te bsgom pa'i lam 'jig rten pa zhi ba la sogs pa dang rags pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can zhig yin ni kun rdzob shes pad ltar 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If the path of cultivation is mundane, such as the path of calming, etc., or the path of grossness, etc., then conventional knowledge arises.

original: shes pa bzhi las zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang / lam la chos shes pa gang yang rung ba zhig go //
analyzed: shes pa bzhi las zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang / lam la chos shes pa gang yang rung ba zhig go //
translated: From four knowledges means from any one of the knowledges of the dharma of suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su shes pa rnams ni ma yin no /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir rjes su shes pa rnams ni ma yin no /
translated: They are not subsequent knowledge because they are not the antidote of the desire realm.

original: // / bam po lnga bcu lnga pa /
analyzed: // / bam po lnga bcu lnga pa /
translated: Five higher perceptions

original: mngon par shes pa lnga zhes bya ba ni zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa ma gtogs @260a * //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga zhes bya ba ni zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa ma gtogs @260a * //
translated: The five higher perceptions are the five higher perceptions of divine eye, divine ear, recollection of former lives, knowledge of others' minds, and knowledge of the exhaustion of contaminants.üîΩFour subsequent knowledges

original: so ; ; rjes su shes pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'o //
analyzed: so ; ; rjes su shes pa bzhi zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang / lam la rjes su shes pa'o //
translated: Four subsequent knowledges are subsequent knowledge of the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path.üîΩTwo Dharma knowledges

original: chos shes pa gnyis zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa dang / lam la dmigs pa dgra ste /
analyzed: chos shes pa gnyis zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa dang / lam la dmigs pa dgra ste /
translated: Two Dharma knowledges are Dharma knowledge focusing on cessation and the path.

original: khams gsum gyi gnyen po nyid du rung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩkun rdzob shes pa mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: khams gsum gyi gnyen po nyid du rung ba'i phyir ro // kun rdzob shes pa mi 'thob ste /
translated: They are suitable as antidotes of the three realms.üîΩConventional knowledge is not obtained because it is not the antidote of the summit of existence.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sa bdun las 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pas thob kyang kun rdzob shes pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sa bdun las 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pas thob kyang kun rdzob shes pa 'thob ste /
translated: Those who are free from attachment to the seven levels obtain conventional knowledge through the mundane path, but they do not obtain it through the transcendent path.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa de'i gnyen po ni 'jig rten las 'das pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa de'i gnyen po ni 'jig rten las 'das pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: The antidote to that aspect of affliction is not only supramundane,

original: kun rdzob shes pa yang yin pas de na de lta bu'i kun rdzob shes pa yang 'thob bo //
analyzed: kun rdzob shes pa yang yin pas de na de lta bu'i kun rdzob shes pa yang 'thob bo //
translated: but also conventional knowledge. Therefore, one also obtains such conventional knowledge there.

original: mi g-yo ba rtogs par byed pa na ni kun rdzob shes pa gnyen po'i ngo bo de lta bu med pas de'i phyir de ni mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba rtogs par byed pa na ni kun rdzob shes pa gnyen po'i ngo bo de lta bu med pas de'i phyir de ni mi 'thob bo //
translated: But when one realizes the immutable, there is no such conventional knowledge that is the nature of an antidote. Therefore, one does not obtain it there.üîΩThe knowledge of elimination is the seventh.

original: der ni zad pa shes pa bdun pa yin zhes bya ba ni bar chad med pa'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir de na zad shes pa 'thob kyi /
analyzed: der ni zad pa shes pa bdun pa yin zhes bya ba ni bar chad med pa'i lam la gnas pa'i phyir de na zad shes pa 'thob kyi /
translated: One obtains the knowledge of elimination there, because one abides on the uninterrupted path.

original: mi skye ba shes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mi skye ba shes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But one does not obtain the knowledge of nonarising.

original: bar chad med pa'i lam la gnas pa ni mi g-yo ba'i chos can ma yin no //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam la gnas pa ni mi g-yo ba'i chos can ma yin no //
translated: Because one who abides on the uninterrupted path is not immutable.

original: mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyis ni mi skye ba shes pa yang 'thob bo //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba'i chos can gyis ni mi skye ba shes pa yang 'thob bo //
translated: But one who is immutable obtains the knowledge of nonarising.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam par grol ba'i lam brgyad la yang shes pa bdun kho na 'thob ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa ji ltar 'thob ce na /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i rnam par grol ba'i lam brgyad la yang shes pa bdun kho na 'thob ces bya ba ni gzhan gyi sems shes pa ji ltar 'thob ce na /
translated: How is knowledge of others' minds obtained?

original: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni bar chad med pa'i lam la bkag gi / rnam par grol ba'i lam la ni ma yin pas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems shes pa ni bar chad med pa'i lam la bkag gi / rnam par grol ba'i lam la ni ma yin pas /
translated: Knowledge of others' minds is blocked on the uninterrupted path, but not on the liberated path.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa gcig spangs pa nas rnam pa brgyad spangs pa'i bar la 'phags pa'i gang zag de lam de las langs nas mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba gzhan gyi sems shes pa snga ma pas khyad par du 'phags pa'i gzhan gyi sems shes pa 'thob
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa gcig spangs pa nas rnam pa brgyad spangs pa'i bar la 'phags pa'i gang zag de lam de las langs nas mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba gzhan gyi sems shes pa snga ma pas khyad par du 'phags pa'i gzhan gyi sems shes pa 'thob
translated: Therefore, when abandoning one stage to eight stages, that ƒÅrya person obtains knowledge of others' minds that is superior to the former knowledge of others' minds that manifests from that path,

original: ste / rgyud kyi khyad par gyi sgo nas gzhan gyi sems shes pa khyad par can du 'dod do //
analyzed: ste / rgyud kyi khyad par gyi sgo nas gzhan gyi sems shes pa khyad par can du 'dod do //
translated: because knowledge of others' minds is asserted to be superior from the perspective of the distinction of mindstreams.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba gnyi gas rnam par grol ba'i lam la 'thob bo zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba gnyi gas rnam par grol ba'i lam la 'thob bo zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Those who are accompanied by attachment and those who are free from attachment obtain it on the path of liberation.

original: sbyor ba'i lam la ni de gnyis kyis zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba de gnyis kyis kun rdzob shes pa yang 'thob bo //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam la ni de gnyis kyis zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags dang bcas pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba de gnyis kyis kun rdzob shes pa yang 'thob bo //
translated: On the path of preparation, they obtain conventional cognition.

original: rnam par grol ba'i lam la ci'i phyir rtsod ce na /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i lam la ci'i phyir rtsod ce na /
translated: Why is there a dispute about the path of liberation?

original: @260b kha cig na re mthong ba'i lam dang 'dra ba'i phyir de na mngon par rtogs pa'i rjes las byung ba dang 'dra bar de 'thob bo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: @260b kha cig na re mthong ba'i lam dang 'dra ba'i phyir de na mngon par rtogs pa'i rjes las byung ba dang 'dra bar de 'thob bo zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: It is obtained on the path of liberation like the subsequent cognition of the truths, because it is similar to the path of seeing.

original: gzhan dag na re /üîΩmngon par rtogs pa yang med la /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re / mngon par rtogs pa yang med la /
translated: Others say:üîΩIt is not like the path of seeing,

original: mthong ba'i lam dang 'dra ba yang ma yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam dang 'dra ba yang ma yin no zhes zer te /
translated: because there is no clear realization.

original: de ltar rtsod do //
analyzed: de ltar rtsod do //
translated: Thus there is a dispute.

original: drug 'thob ste snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos dang rjes dang sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam shes pa rnams so //üîΩkun rdzob shes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: drug 'thob ste snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni chos dang rjes dang sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam shes pa rnams so // kun rdzob shes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The former are the cognition of phenomena, subsequent cognition, the cognition of suffering, the cognition of origin, the cognition of cessation and the cognition of the path.üîΩConventional cognition is not obtained because it is similar to the path of seeing.

original: mthong ba'i lam dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dir mthong ba'i lam dang ci zhig 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dir mthong ba'i lam dang ci zhig 'dra zhe na /
translated: What is the path of seeing like?

original: 'bras bu 'thob pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'thob pa ste /
translated: It is the obtainment of results.

original: ji ltar mthong ba'i lam gyis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba'i lam gyis rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'am /
translated: Just as the path of seeing obtains the result of stream entry,

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'am /
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba'am /
translated: the result of once returning,üîΩthe result of nonreturning,

original: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'thob ba de bzhin du 'dis kyang bar chad med pa'i lam gyis slob pa'i dbang po sbyong ba na rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa dbang po rnon pos bsdus pa 'dus byas dag 'thob la /
analyzed: phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu 'thob ba de bzhin du 'dis kyang bar chad med pa'i lam gyis slob pa'i dbang po sbyong ba na rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu la sogs pa dbang po rnon pos bsdus pa 'dus byas dag 'thob la /
translated: so too, when training in the learner's faculties by the uninterrupted path, one obtains conditioned results subsumed by the sharp faculty such as the result of stream entry and so on.

original: mthong ba'i lam la yang bar chad med pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs na kun rdzob shes pa mi 'thob pa ltar 'dir yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la yang bar chad med pa'i lam gyi gnas skabs na kun rdzob shes pa mi 'thob pa ltar 'dir yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as conventional knowledge is not obtained on the path of seeing when one is on the uninterrupted path, it is the same here.

original: de lta bas na mthong ba'i lam dang 'dra ba'i phyir bar chad med pa'i lam la kun rdzob shes pa mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: de lta bas na mthong ba'i lam dang 'dra ba'i phyir bar chad med pa'i lam la kun rdzob shes pa mi 'thob bo //
translated: Therefore, because it is similar to the path of seeing, conventional knowledge is not obtained on the uninterrupted path.

original: de bzhin du drug 'thob po zhes bya ba ni chos dang rjes dang sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang / lam shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du drug 'thob po zhes bya ba ni chos dang rjes dang sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang / lam shes pa rnams so //
translated: Six are obtained means the knowledges of phenomena, subsequent, suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: 'dir yang srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa yang mi 'thob la /
analyzed: 'dir yang srid pa'i rtse mo'i gnyen po ma yin pa'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa yang mi 'thob la /
translated: Here, conventional knowledge is not obtained because it is not the antidote of the summit of existence.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te kun rdzob shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin gyi snying rje bzhin du zhe sdang med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par gyur na ni sems can thams cad la dmigs par yang 'grub parüîΩmi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni gal te kun rdzob shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ma yin gyi snying rje bzhin du zhe sdang med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par gyur na ni sems can thams cad la dmigs par yang 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not so, if it were not the nature of knowledge of the conventional, but were the nature of non-aversion, like compassion, then it would not be established as having all sentient beings as its object.

original: khams gsum pa'i sems can la dmigs par 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i sems can la dmigs par 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It would not be established as having the sentient beings of the three realms as its object.

original: dper na snying rje ni khams gsum pa la dmigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na snying rje ni khams gsum pa la dmigs pa ma yin no //
translated: For example, compassion does not have the three realms as its object.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: sems can sdug bsngal ba la dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems can sdug bsngal ba la dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: It has as its object sentient beings who are suffering.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can la dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems can la dmigs pa yin te /
translated: It has as its object sentient beings who live in the desire realm.

original: 'di yang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: This is similar to that.

original: snying rje bzhin du sdug bsngal gsum gyi rnam pa can du yang 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: snying rje bzhin du sdug bsngal gsum gyi rnam pa can du yang 'grub par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It would not be established as having the aspect of the three kinds of suffering, like compassion.

original: ji ltar snying rje sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal kho na'i rnam pa can yin gyi sdug bsngal gsum gyi rnam pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar snying rje sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal kho na'i rnam pa can yin gyi sdug bsngal gsum gyi rnam pa can ma yin te /
translated: Why is compassion not like the aspects of the three kinds of suffering?

original: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa can de lta bur mi 'gyur ba zhig nas @272a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa can de lta bur mi 'gyur ba zhig nas @272a * //
translated: It is not like the aspects of the suffering of suffering, the suffering of change, and the suffering of the formative forces,

original: sdug bsngal gsum gyi rnam pa can du yang 'dod de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum gyi rnam pa can du yang 'dod de /
translated: but it is accepted as having the aspects of the three kinds of suffering.

original: de'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is of the nature of conventional knowledge.

original: chen po'i sgrar brjod pa nyid kyi rgyu bstan pa'i phyir 'di ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: chen po'i sgrar brjod pa nyid kyi rgyu bstan pa'i phyir 'di ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The reason why it is described as great is stated beginning with ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚ÄùüîΩIt is because it is accomplished by a great accumulation of merit and

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen pos yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen pos yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: knowledge.

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs chen pos yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir dang / ye shes kyi tshogs chen pos yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs chen pos yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir dang / ye shes kyi tshogs chen pos yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: because it is accomplished by the great accumulation of merit and because it is accomplished by the great accumulation of wisdom.

original: de la bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po ni pha rol tu phyin pa gsum po sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po ni pha rol tu phyin pa gsum po sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The great accumulation of merit consists of the three perfections of generosity, morality, and patience.

original: ye shes kyi tshogs chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs chen po ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The great accumulation of wisdom consists of the perfection of wisdom.

original: brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag ni gnyi gar gtogs pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyi ga yin te /
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag ni gnyi gar gtogs pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyi ga yin te /
translated: The perfections of effort and meditation are both, because they belong to both.

original: brtson 'grus med par sbyin pa sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par len pa dang / bzod pa bsgom pa yang med pas brtson 'grus ni bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po dang cha mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: brtson 'grus med par sbyin pa sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par len pa dang / bzod pa bsgom pa yang med pas brtson 'grus ni bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po dang cha mthun pa yin no //
translated: Since without effort there is no generosity, no taking up of morality, and no cultivation of patience, effort is the companion of the great accumulation of merit.

original: de bzhin du brtson 'grus med par shes rab mi 'byung bas ye shes kyi tshogs chen po dang cha mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du brtson 'grus med par shes rab mi 'byung bas ye shes kyi tshogs chen po dang cha mthun pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, since wisdom does not arise without effort, it is in conformity with the great accumulation of intuition.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan yang byams pa la sogs pa tshad med pa rnam pa bzhi bsgom pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po dang cha mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan yang byams pa la sogs pa tshad med pa rnam pa bzhi bsgom pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa ni bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po dang cha mthun pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, the meditative concentration which is in conformity with the cultivation of the four immeasurables, beginning with love, is in conformity with the great accumulation of merit.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i bsam gtan ni ye shes kyi tshogs chen po dang cha mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos sum cu rtsa bdun bsgom pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i bsam gtan ni ye shes kyi tshogs chen po dang cha mthun pa yin no //
translated: The meditative concentration which is in conformity with the cultivation of the thirty-seven aids to enlightenment, beginning with the applications of mindfulness, is in conformity with the great accumulation of intuition.

original: de ltar bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po dag gis yang dag par 'grub cing 'grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po dag gis yang dag par 'grub cing 'grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, it is in conformity with the great accumulations of merit and intuition, and is established in the establishment of those.

original: thugs rje 'di che bas na thugs rje chen po'o //
analyzed: thugs rje 'di che bas na thugs rje chen po'o //
translated: Since this compassion is great, it is great compassion.

original: rnam pa ni sdug bsngal gsum la rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sdug bsngal gsum char la yang dmigs kyi /
analyzed: rnam pa ni sdug bsngal gsum la rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sdug bsngal gsum char la yang dmigs kyi /
translated: It focuses on the three kinds of suffering,

original: snying rje bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal kho na la dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snying rje bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal kho na la dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: unlike compassion, which focuses on the suffering of suffering alone.üîΩIts object field is sentient beings of the three realms.

original: dmigs pa ni khams gsum pa'i sems can la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar khams gsum du skyes pa'i sems can rnams la dmigs kyi /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni khams gsum pa'i sems can la dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar khams gsum du skyes pa'i sems can rnams la dmigs kyi /
translated: It focuses on sentient beings born in the three realms,

original: snying rje bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa kho na la dmigs pa ni ma yin te /üîΩspyod yul 'dod pa'i sems can yin //
analyzed: snying rje bzhin du 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa kho na la dmigs pa ni ma yin te / spyod yul 'dod pa'i sems can yin //
translated: unlike compassion, which focuses on those born in the desire realm alone.

original: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Its object field is sentient beings of the desire realm.üîΩIts equality is that it engages all sentient beings in the same way.

original: mnyam pa nyid ni @272b sems can thams cad la 'dra bar 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar khams gsum du gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad la 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi rnam par 'dra bar 'jug ste /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid ni @272b sems can thams cad la 'dra bar 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar khams gsum du gtogs pa'i sems can thams cad la 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal gyi rnam par 'dra bar 'jug ste /
translated: It engages all sentient beings belonging to the three realms in the same way, as the suffering of contaminated formations.

original: de'i phyir yang thugs rje chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang thugs rje chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called great compassion.üîΩBecause there is nothing greater than it.

original: de bas ches che ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas shin tu rno ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bas ches che ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid yin pas shin tu rno ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is the essence of wisdom, and so it is very sharp.

original: ji ltar des thugs rje che ba ltar snying rje ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar des thugs rje che ba ltar snying rje ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: Compassion is not like that, in terms of its greatness.

original: tha dad du bya ba ni khyad par ro //üîΩzhe sdang med pa dang gti mug med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du snying rje ni zhe sdang med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: tha dad du bya ba ni khyad par ro // zhe sdang med pa dang gti mug med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni go rims bzhin du snying rje ni zhe sdang med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: The difference is the distinction.üîΩBecause it is the essence of non-hatred and non-delusion, respectively.

original: thugs rje chen po ni gti mug med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po ni gti mug med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Compassion is the essence of non-hatred, and great compassion is the essence of non-delusion.üîΩBecause it has the aspect of one suffering and three sufferings.

original: sdug bsngal gcig dang gsum gyi rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni snying rje ni sdug bsngal gcig gi rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gcig dang gsum gyi rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni snying rje ni sdug bsngal gcig gi rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Compassion has the aspect of one suffering,

original: thugs rje chen po ni sdug bsngal gsum gyi rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: thugs rje chen po ni sdug bsngal gsum gyi rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Great compassion is the aspect of the three kinds of suffering.

original: 'og ma thams cad la yang grangs bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'og ma thams cad la yang grangs bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied in order to all the other perfections.üîΩBecause it is on the level of the four meditations and the fourth meditation.

original: bsam gtan bzhi dang bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni snying rje ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi dang bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni snying rje ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin no //
translated: Compassion is on the level of the fourth meditation.

original: mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dag ni bsam gtan dang po smos pas bsdus pa'i phyir sa drug pa zhes ni ma bshad do //
analyzed: mi lcogs pa med pa dang / bsam gtan khyad par can dag ni bsam gtan dang po smos pas bsdus pa'i phyir sa drug pa zhes ni ma bshad do //
translated: The levels of the preliminary stage of the first meditation and the special meditation are not mentioned as the sixth level, because they are included in the mention of the first meditation.

original: thugs rje chen po ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa kho na yin te ting nge 'dzin thams cad las su rung ba nyid kyis de kho nas de skyed par nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa kho na yin te ting nge 'dzin thams cad las su rung ba nyid kyis de kho nas de skyed par nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Great compassion is only on the level of the fourth meditation, because it is able to generate that meditation itself through the complete serviceability of all concentrations.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rgyud las skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rang sangs rgyas dang so so'i skye bo rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi rgyud las skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rang sangs rgyas dang so so'i skye bo rnams bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the Solitary Buddhas and ordinary persons.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral bas thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni snying rje ni 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral bas 'thob la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral bas thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni snying rje ni 'dod pa las 'dod chags dang bral bas 'thob la /
translated: Because it is attained through freedom from attachment to the desire realm and the peak of existence. Compassion is attained through freedom from attachment to the desire realm.

original: thugs rje chen po ni srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral bas 'thob bo //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po ni srid pa'i rtse mo las 'dod chags dang bral bas 'thob bo //
translated: Great compassion is attained through freedom from attachment to the peak of existence.

original: yongs su mi skyob pa dang yongs su skyob ces bya ba ni snying rje ni nyan thos la sogs par snying rje bar byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad pas yid la nyam nga ba 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig snye 'khor ba'i 'jigs paüîΩlas ni @273a * //
analyzed: yongs su mi skyob pa dang yongs su skyob ces bya ba ni snying rje ni nyan thos la sogs par snying rje bar byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad pas yid la nyam nga ba 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig snye 'khor ba'i 'jigs pa las ni @273a * //
translated: It is said that compassion does not completely protect, but great compassion completely protects. Compassion only causes distress, because it only causes distress for disciples, etc.

original: yongs su mi skyob po //
analyzed: yongs su mi skyob po //
translated: It does not completely protect from the fear of samsara.üîΩGreat compassion completely protects from the fear of samsara.

original: thugs rje chen pos ni bcom ldan 'das thugs rje bar mdzad pa ni 'khor ba'i 'jigs pa chen po las yongs su skyob po //
analyzed: thugs rje chen pos ni bcom ldan 'das thugs rje bar mdzad pa ni 'khor ba'i 'jigs pa chen po las yongs su skyob po //
translated: By great compassion, the Lord protects from the great fear of cyclic existence.

original: mi 'dra ba dang 'dra bar thugs rje mdzad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni snying rjes ni sdug bsngal ba kho na la snying rje ba'i phyir mi 'dra bar snying rje bar byed de /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba dang 'dra bar thugs rje mdzad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni snying rjes ni sdug bsngal ba kho na la snying rje ba'i phyir mi 'dra bar snying rje bar byed de /
translated: Because compassion is felt for the suffering, compassion is felt unequally;

original: thugs rje chen pos ni sems can thams cad la 'dra bar thugs rje bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs rje chen pos ni sems can thams cad la 'dra bar thugs rje bar mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but great compassion is felt equally for all sentient beings.

original: sngon gyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis yang dag par 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs snga ma dag gi bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs sngar bshad pas yang dag par 'grub po //
analyzed: sngon gyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs kyis yang dag par 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs snga ma dag gi bsod nams kyi tshogs dang / ye shes kyi tshogs sngar bshad pas yang dag par 'grub po //
translated: It is accomplished by the accumulation of merit and knowledge in the past. The accumulation of merit and knowledge in previous lives is explained above.

original: chos kyi sku yongs su 'grub ces bya ba la /
analyzed: chos kyi sku yongs su 'grub ces bya ba la /
translated: It is the accomplishment of the Dharma Body.

original: chos kyi sku ni zag pa med pa'i chos kyi rgyun gyi tshogs sam gnas yongs su gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni zag pa med pa'i chos kyi rgyun gyi tshogs sam gnas yongs su gyur pa yin no //
translated: The Dharma Body is the collection of the uncontaminated dharmas or the transformation of the basis.

original: don spyod pa zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: don spyod pa zhes bya ba la //
translated: The explanation of the activity of benefiting others:

original: don ni 'jig rten gyi mtho ris dang byang grol mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: don ni 'jig rten gyi mtho ris dang byang grol mdzad pa'o //
translated: The benefit is the attainment of the higher realms and liberation in the world.

original: de sgrub pa ni don spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de sgrub pa ni don spyod pa ste /
translated: The activity is the activity of benefiting others.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gzhan gyi don mdzad pa'i rgyu thugs rje chen po ni 'dra'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi gzhan gyi don mdzad pa'i rgyu thugs rje chen po ni 'dra'o //
translated: The cause of the activity of benefiting others of all Buddhas is the same, which is great compassion.

original: dus ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni thams cad la sbyar ro //
analyzed: dus ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni thams cad la sbyar ro //
translated: As for ‚Äúin accordance with the time,‚Äù this applies to all.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is it so?

original: yun shin tu ring ba dang yun thung ngur 'tsho ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yun shin tu ring ba dang yun thung ngur 'tsho ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said that it is because of living for a very long time and for a short time.

original: dus ji lta ba bzhin du skye dgu rnams kyi tshe ring ba'i tshe ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sku tshe ring bar 'byung la /
analyzed: dus ji lta ba bzhin du skye dgu rnams kyi tshe ring ba'i tshe ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sku tshe ring bar 'byung la /
translated: When the lifespan of beings is long, the lifespan of the Bhagavat Buddhas is long.

original: thung ba'i tshe ni thung bar ro //
analyzed: thung ba'i tshe ni thung bar ro //
translated: When the lifespan is short, it is short.

original: de bzhin du ci rigs par 'jig rten gyi rgyal rig sa bkur ba'i tshe ni rgyal rigs su 'byung la /
analyzed: de bzhin du ci rigs par 'jig rten gyi rgyal rig sa bkur ba'i tshe ni rgyal rigs su 'byung la /

analyzed: de bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i bong tshod chung ba'i tshe ni sku bong tshod chung la /

original: rgyu phun sum tshogs pa ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs ni mtshan nyid do //

analyzed: phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa ni 'gro ba'i don spyod pa'i mtshan nyid do //

original: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs thams cad la goms pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs thams cad la goms pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The perfection of practice is the perfection of the stores of merit and knowledge.

original: bsod nams ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: bsod nams ni pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'i ngo bo nyid do //

original: ye shes ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid dag ste /
analyzed: ye shes ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid dag ste /

original: bsod nams dang ye shes de dag thams cad kyi chogs so //
analyzed: bsod nams dang ye shes de dag thams cad kyi chogs so //

original: de goms pa ni yang dang yang du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de goms pa ni yang dang yang du sbyor ba'o //

analyzed: @273b yun ring po nas goms pa zhes bya ba ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du'o //

analyzed: bar chad med pa'i goms pa zhes bya ba ni bar chad dang bcas pa ma yin par ro //

analyzed: ye shes la sogs pa phun sum tshogs pa bzhir 'gyur bas de dag kyang 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag go //

original: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste zhes 'chad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste zhes 'chad par 'gyur la /

original: phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa yang rnam pa bzhi ste /

original: ji lta zhe na //
analyzed: ji lta zhe na //
translated: How so?üîΩThe perfection of the act of liberating from the suffering of the three miserable realms and cyclic existence forever.

original: ngan song gsum dang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las gtan du thar par mdzad pa phun sum tshogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba la sogs pa ngan song gsum dang 'khor ba ste /

analyzed: yang na theg pa gsum dang bde 'gro la 'god par mdzad pa phun sum tshogs pa'o zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi theg pa la sogs pa theg pa gsum dang bde 'gro la 'god pa'o //

analyzed: de nyid phun sum tshogs pa yin te yang na phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa bzhi de yin no //

original: 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa ni 'bras bu 'byin par nges par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa ni 'bras bu 'byin par nges par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not fruitless because it is certain to yield a result.

original: 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba ni 'bras bu lha'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba ni 'bras bu lha'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is pleasing because its result is the heavenly realm.

original: 'bras bu mchog tu gyur pa ni 'bras bu mang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu mchog tu gyur pa ni 'bras bu mang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is supreme because its result is abundant.

original: 'bras bu myur ba ni 'bras bu mthong ba'i chos la sogs pa la myong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu myur ba ni 'bras bu mthong ba'i chos la sogs pa la myong bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is swift because its result is experienced in this life, etc.

original: 'bras bu mtha' bzang ba ni 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu mtha' bzang ba ni 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir yin te /
translated: It has a good end because its result is nirvana.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni de dag mnga' ba'i phyir bsod nams kyi zhing bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni de dag mnga' ba'i phyir bsod nams kyi zhing bla na med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The Tathagata is said to be the unsurpassed field of merit because he possesses these.

original: bya ba zhes bya ba ni mchod pa la sogs pa phan pa'o//
analyzed: bya ba zhes bya ba ni mchod pa la sogs pa phan pa'o//
translated: Action means benefit such as worship.

original: @275a * // ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni ji srid par te /
analyzed: @275a * // ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni ji srid par te /
translated: As appropriate means as far as possible.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yon tan nyon mongs pa med pa dang // smon nas shes pa la sogs pa kha cig ni nyan thos dang thun mong yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi yon tan nyon mongs pa med pa dang // smon nas shes pa la sogs pa kha cig ni nyan thos dang thun mong yin no //
translated: Some of the qualities of the transcendent buddhas, such as the absence of afflictions and knowledge through resolve, are shared with sravakas.

original: mngon par shes pa dang / bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa la sogs pa kha cig ni so so'i skye bo dang thun mong yin no //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa dang / bsam gtan dang gzugs med pa la sogs pa kha cig ni so so'i skye bo dang thun mong yin no //
translated: Some, such as the higher perceptions, the dhyanas, the formless states and so on, are shared with ordinary beings.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The words and so on include emptiness, signlessness and wishlessness.

original: 'ga' yang de la dmigs nas 'dod chags sam zhe sdang ngam nga rgyal skye bar mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni des bdag nyid mthong ba la sogs pa yongs su spong ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'ga' yang de la dmigs nas 'dod chags sam zhe sdang ngam nga rgyal skye bar mi 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni des bdag nyid mthong ba la sogs pa yongs su spong ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is said that no one can develop attachment, aversion or pride with regard to them because they completely abandon the view of self and so on.

original: ji lta ji ltar ting nge 'dzin las ma langs pa des bdag mthong nas 'di'i 'dod chags skye bar ma gyur cig /'di'i zhe sdang dang / 'di'i nga rgyal dang / 'di'i bag med pa skye bar ma gyur cig ces bya bar mngon par rtogs par gyur pa de lta de ltar ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas kyang rjes su mthun par byed do //
analyzed: ji lta ji ltar ting nge 'dzin las ma langs pa des bdag mthong nas 'di'i 'dod chags skye bar ma gyur cig /'di'i zhe sdang dang / 'di'i nga rgyal dang / 'di'i bag med pa skye bar ma gyur cig ces bya bar mngon par rtogs par gyur pa de lta de ltar ting nge 'dzin de las langs nas kyang rjes su mthun par byed do //
translated: Just as he has realized, ‚ÄúMay I not see myself rising from meditative concentration in such a way that desire would arise for this person, or aversion or pride or negligence would arise for this person,‚Äù just so, having risen from that meditative concentration, he acts in accordance with that realization.

original: 'di ni gzhan gyi sems srung ba'i thabs kyi khyad par yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan gyi sems srung ba'i thabs kyi khyad par yin gyi /
translated: This is the distinctive method of protecting the minds of others.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin de skyes pa tsam kho na'i mthus gzhan dag gi nyon mongs pa skye bar mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don du bzung ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin de skyes pa tsam kho na'i mthus gzhan dag gi nyon mongs pa skye bar mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don du bzung ngo //
translated: It should be understood that the mere arising of that meditative concentration free of conflict does not have the power to prevent the arising of the passions of others.

original: nyon mongs par mi byed pas na zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs par byed par mi 'gyur bas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyon mongs par mi byed pas na zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs par byed par mi 'gyur bas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it does not cause passion means because it does not cause the arising of passion.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa ni lam sla ba rnams kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa ni lam sla ba rnams kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fourth meditation is the best of the easy paths.

original: nyon mongs pa med pa ni de'i sa pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa ni de'i sa pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: The absence of conflict is of the stage of the fourth meditation.

original: sa gzhan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sa gzhan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not of another stage.

original: yongs su spang bar mi nus so zhes bya ba ni yongs su nyams pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su spang bar mi nus so zhes bya ba ni yongs su nyams pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It cannot be abandoned, because retrogressing from it is possible.

original: nyon mongs pa bzhi dang bcas pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bzhi dang bcas pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba dag yin no //
translated: It is associated with four defilements, attachment, etc., which are to be abandoned by cultivation.

original: nyon mongs pa bzhi med pa ni kun du 'gro ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag yin te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa bzhi med pa ni kun du 'gro ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba dag yin te /
translated: It is not associated with the four defilements, i.e., with the universal defilements to be abandoned by insight,

original: kun du 'gro ba ni rang gi sa mtha' dag la dmigs pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rgyud la dmigs pa yang yod pas yongs su spang bar mi nus so //
analyzed: kun du 'gro ba ni rang gi sa mtha' dag la dmigs pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rgyud la dmigs pa yang yod pas yongs su spang bar mi nus so //
translated: because the latter have all the stages for their domain. Since they have other streams for their domain, they cannot be abandoned.üîΩIt has all for its object-field.

original: de'i dmigs pa thams cad cad do zhes bya ba ni thams cad la dmigs pas dmigs pa thams cad do //
analyzed: de'i dmigs pa thams cad cad do zhes bya ba ni thams cad la dmigs pas dmigs pa thams cad do //
translated: It has all for its object-field, because it has all for its domain.

original: yang na 'di'i dmigs pa thams cad yin pas dmigs pa thams cad de nyon mongs pa med pa bzhin du nyon mongs pa tsam la dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na 'di'i dmigs pa thams cad yin pas dmigs pa thams cad de nyon mongs pa med pa bzhin du nyon mongs pa tsam la dmigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Or, since it focuses on all objects, it focuses on all objects, like the absence of conflict, but it does not focus on just affliction.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa yang yin no zhes @275b bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa la dmigs pa yang yin no zhes @275b bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It also focuses on form and so on.

original: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re zhes smos pa ni gzhan dag gi gzhung lugs ltar na gzugs med pa yang mkhyen to zhes ston te /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba rnams na re zhes smos pa ni gzhan dag gi gzhung lugs ltar na gzugs med pa yang mkhyen to zhes ston te /
translated: The term ‚Äúaccording to the Vaibhasikas‚Äù indicates that others assert that it also knows formless states.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul du ma gyur pa ni med do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul du ma gyur pa ni med do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: There is nothing that is not the object of buddhas.

original: smon nas shes pas gzugs med pa rnams mngon sum du ni mi shes so //
analyzed: smon nas shes pas gzugs med pa rnams mngon sum du ni mi shes so //
translated: It is not directly perceived by knowledge through prayer.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar smon nas shes pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar smon nas shes pa ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa yin te /
translated: Because knowledge through prayer is the level of the fourth absorption.

original: rang dang 'og sa'i yul can yin zhes 'chad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rang dang 'og sa'i yul can yin zhes 'chad par 'gyur la /
translated: It is said that it has the level of its own realm and lower realms as its object.

original: smos nas shes pa yang mngon par shes pa dang 'dra ba yin pas so //
analyzed: smos nas shes pa yang mngon par shes pa dang 'dra ba yin pas so //
translated: Knowledge through prayer is similar to higher perception.

original: rgyu mthun pa dang spyod pa'i bye brag las zhes bya ba de la rgyu mthun pa ni dman zhing dman pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa dang spyod pa'i bye brag las zhes bya ba de la rgyu mthun pa ni dman zhing dman pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdue to the specific nature of their causes and their practice‚Äù means that the specific nature of their causes is inferior.

original: spyod pa ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la gnas pa yin no //üîΩde ltar na 'bras bus rgyu rjes su dpag la /
analyzed: spyod pa ni gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la gnas pa yin no // de ltar na 'bras bus rgyu rjes su dpag la /
translated: Their practice is to abide in the formless states of composure.üîΩThus, the result can be inferred from the cause, and the cause can be inferred from the result.

original: rgyus kyang 'bras bu rjes su dpag go zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: rgyus kyang 'bras bu rjes su dpag go zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the point that is being illustrated.

original: de nas shi 'phos pa rnams dang / de'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa rnams kyi de gnyi ga 'dir mngon sum pa yin no //üîΩ'dir dpe ni zhing pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni dper na zhing pas 'bras bus sa bon dang sa bon gyis 'bras bu rtogs pa lta bu'am /
analyzed: de nas shi 'phos pa rnams dang / de'i snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa rnams kyi de gnyi ga 'dir mngon sum pa yin no // 'dir dpe ni zhing pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni dper na zhing pas 'bras bus sa bon dang sa bon gyis 'bras bu rtogs pa lta bu'am /
translated: The two of them can be directly perceived by those who have died and passed on from this world and by those who have attained the formless states of composure.üîΩThe example that is being given here is that of a farmer.üîΩFor example, a farmer can infer the seed from the fruit and the fruit from the seed.

original: dper na zhing pas zhing 'di lta bu lus ni 'bru 'di lta bur 'gyur ro zhes bya bar shes pa'am /
analyzed: dper na zhing pas zhing 'di lta bu lus ni 'bru 'di lta bur 'gyur ro zhes bya bar shes pa'am /
translated: Or, for example, a farmer can know that a particular field will produce a particular kind of grain.

original: 'bru mthong nas 'di'i zhing ni 'di 'dra'o zhes rjes su dpag par byed pa de bzhin du sems can lus zhi ba mthong nas 'di ni gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos pa'o zhes bya ba dang / gzugs med pa dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rjes su dpog go //
analyzed: 'bru mthong nas 'di'i zhing ni 'di 'dra'o zhes rjes su dpag par byed pa de bzhin du sems can lus zhi ba mthong nas 'di ni gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos pa'o zhes bya ba dang / gzugs med pa dag tu skye bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rjes su dpog go //
translated: Just as one infers the field of a grain from seeing the grain, in the same way, one infers that a sentient being who has a peaceful body has died in the formless realm and will be reborn in the formless realm.

original: smon pa sngar btang ba zhes bya ba ni gtod pa sngar btang ba ste /
analyzed: smon pa sngar btang ba zhes bya ba ni gtod pa sngar btang ba ste /
translated: Having previously made a vow is having previously made a resolution.

original: smon cing gtod nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: smon cing gtod nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: ting nge 'dzin de'i yul du ji tsam zhig gyur pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi yul du yang ji tsam zhig gyur pa de tsam shes la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de'i yul du ji tsam zhig gyur pa zhes bya ba ni nyan thos kyi yul du yang ji tsam zhig gyur pa de tsam shes la /
translated: To the extent that it is the domain of that concentration is to the extent that it is the domain of the ≈õrƒÅvaka.

analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi bar du yang rang gi yul du ji tsam zhig gyur pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: To the extent that it is the domain of a pratyekabuddha is to the extent that it is the domain of a pratyekabuddha.

original: chos so so yang dag par rig pa ni 'dir bstan pa'i chos yin no //
analyzed: chos so so yang dag par rig pa ni 'dir bstan pa'i chos yin no //
translated: The Dharma discernment is the Dharma that is taught.

analyzed: chos zhes bya ba'i sgra ni don du ma ste /

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: dge slong dag khyed la chos bshad par bya ste / thog mar dge ba / bar du dge ba /

original: tha mar dge ba /üîΩdon bzang po //
analyzed: tha mar dge ba / don bzang po //
translated: good in the middle,üîΩand good in the end.

original: tshig 'bru bzang po //
analyzed: tshig 'bru bzang po //

original: ma 'dres pa /üîΩyongs su dag pa /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa / yongs su dag pa /

original: yongs su byang ba /
analyzed: yongs su byang ba /

original: tshangs par spyod pa rab tu bshad do zhes bya ba der ni bshad pa'i chos yin no //üîΩchos @276a * //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa rab tu bshad do zhes bya ba der ni bshad pa'i chos yin no // chos @276a * //

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /

analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'o zhes bya ba der ni sgrub pa'i chos yin no //

analyzed: chos la skyabs su 'gro'o zhes bya ba der ni 'bras bu'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //

analyzed: thogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni bzlog par mi nus pa'o //

analyzed: dmigs pa la sogs pa ni logs shig smos pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rigs pa dang thags thogs med par mngon par brjod pa nyid ces bya ba la rigs pa ni don dang 'brel pa'o //

analyzed: rigs pa dang thags thogs med par mngon par brjod pa ni rigs pa dang thags thogs med par mngon par brjod pa'o //

original: de'i ngo bo ste /

analyzed: rigs pa dang thags thogs med par mngon par brjod pa nyid de la'o //

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba ni ting nge 'dzin la dbang ba'o //
